Reviews.Title: “Excellent LOCATION!!, makes for a great NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: TwiddyandCompany
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little small, but great bathroom and view. However, what makes this hotel so unique and appealing is the location. There are about 30 awesome restaurants, bars, cafes, and offices within a 5 minute walk. The area has an almost electric atmosphere, even for NYC. After finishing up work, we had a drink at the bar downstairs and it's some of the best people watching around. Will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jillian Beeman saved the stay!”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel Gansevoort on 9th Avenue around 4PM on March 20, 2012. My initial check-in experience was a little rough as the person seemed new. No problem, everyone starts somewhere. I get to my room and it was small. No problem, it's New York City. Then a loud humming sound goes... it's coming from all the roof top HVAC units right below me. I'm on the 5th floor... these things are humming... I'm here until Friday, I better go ask if they can move me. 2nd try with the reception desk, a woman tells me she has something at a higher floor and it's a king bed. Awesome. I waited for 45 minutes to 1 hour. It's 5:20PM now. I go back to the front desk and Jillian is there. She checks on it and tells me that house keeping is not responding. Instead of keeping all of this a mystery, she takes the initiative and tells me she is going to go check out the room personally and find out what is going on. Jillian cares! About 10 minutes later, she is back and tells me the room has a crack piece of glass and that engineering is there working on it. At about 6PM, I'm thinking, I need to check in... this process has taken too long. Jillian Beeman says, "thank you so much for your patience. I'm going to upgrade you immediately. This has taken way too long." Thank you Jillian Beeman for going above and beyond the call of duty to ensure that I have a great stay. I did have a great stay because of your actions. You should be the example for the staff at Hotel Gansevoort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tiny Suite... great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelsLisa
Reviews.Content: Cool vibe in the lobby because of the pool table & bar... front desk has the oddest Greek column in the middle; it should totally be removed as it doesn't belong there at all! Staff is ok,.... Stayed in a suite with a nice view but wasn't impressed with the room, too tiny, but that is usual in NY... I love its location and that is why I keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “wow! the best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: margaret s
Reviews.Content: As a world traveler I have had the opprotunity to stay in numerous hotels. I recently stayed at the Gansevoort hotel located in the meat packing disrltrict. Upon entering the hotel, we were greeted by a cheerful doorman, Omar. The front desk was quick and efficient regarding our checking into the hotel, thanks to Kim. Although we were very tempted to stay in our room due to its elegance, we decided to experiance Manhattan at its finest. A very charming security guard, Rashid, was very informative as to the emenities of the hotel and the hotspots in the city. The staff at the Gansevoort was extremely hospitable and made our stay an experiance to remember. I would not only reccomend this hotel but will bebreturning back to it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !”
Reviews.Author: Flavia S
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have just got back from a 4 days trip in NYC. We always stay in Meatpacking District, and this time we've decided to try Gansevoort Hotel. It was very, very nice ! The service is good. Jaqueline, the general manager was really nice and got us a room before the check-in time... this was really, really amazing ! I just think that the Concierge service could improve a little. Thank you very much for everything !

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: nitk48
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to say I have stayed at the Gansevoort hotel on Park Ave and the service and hotel there was phenomenal and I gave them 5 stars. This hotel just had bad service from the people working. They didn't open doors for you when you cam. And an incident we had was we wanted to get a cab and the doorman told us to go outside and get one.i guess it was too cold outside for him. But it took us like 30 minutes before we could even catch a cab at meat packing. The staff is Horrrible!, except on the last day when we were leaving, the doorman Omar was very helpful, he opened the door for us. Helped us with the luggage and got us a taxi. Furthermore, I cannot recommend this hotel as I received poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jnelson777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Manhattan Suite, connected to a double, for a bachelorette party this past weekend. We were unable to park our oversized limo. & Jacqueline, who is the front desk manager, completely helped us rectify the situation and went out of her way to accommodate myself and all 8 of my guests. We will now be frequenting the gansevoort, due to her and the hotel's exceptional service!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy synonymous with limited service?”
Reviews.Author: amazingspirit
Reviews.Content: My initial impression of the hotel was not great, but I was willing to keep an open mind. When I arrived, the doormen? came rushing over to the limo driver and asked if he can take a client to somewhere before I got out of the limo. The driver politely asked him to wait until our transaction was finished, but the guy kept on badgering him. To my surprise, there are no help with luggage, you roll your own luggage to check in. I'm curious if the bouncers and doorman are one and the same; if so, do they help guests with luggage? Upon departure, I had to ask the doormen to 'please open the door' for me while I rolled my own luggage out. Out of my 5 days stay and multiple taxi trips, I was offered help ONCE to get a taxi. The room is overpriced compared to the services offered. The maids are on auto pilot; a few hooks from the bathroom curtain came off so I left it on the side of the tub, it was there for 3 days! Nothing was done, the curtain cannot close properly, I'm wondering if the hooks are still sitting on the side of the tub. I must say most of the workers are courteous, compared with other New York hotels in similar price category, this needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MardiGrasMom
Reviews.Content: The lobby at the Hotel Gansevoort turns into a nightclub/bar scene at night- dark, loud music. This Hotel is in a great location for shopping and restaurants. We walked across the street for a great dinner at Pastis and another night had a nice meal around the corner at the Fig and Olive. The area is packed with crowds and limos at night. The staff is so so nice and seemed to go out of their way to make us feel welcome. I was traveling with my Mother as well as my 18 year old daughter. Our room was not big but fairly comfortable. My Mother and I were clearly the oldest people in the place.This is a great hotel for young people if they can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “A Breath of Fresh and Rejuvenating Air”
Reviews.Author: herbnass
Reviews.Content: I have a new favorite hotel in my home city of New York, and it is the Gansevoort in the so-called meatpacking district of New York. The staff could not be nicer and more welcoming. My wife and I live near the big city, but staying at the Gansvoort allows us to have a quick and easy mini vacation, especially with that heated pool on the roof top. We liked it so much the first time we stayed that we booked it again the following weekend.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Choice for Hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie O
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Gansevoort several times when I stay in New York City. Each time I stay I feel like my experience exceeds the next! Upon entering you are greeted with the nicest staff I have ever seen. We stayed in the Manhattan Suite last week and it was incredible! Since there was only 3 of us, we had a lot of room to move about in the suite.The suite had a nice space and I felt comfortable the second I walked in.It helped that there were 2 bathrooms considering the time that women take to get ready! I was even checked in before 1pm, but since it is the city, you can always find something to do even if your room isn't ready yet. I was not expecting to have complimentary chocolates and a bottle of wine delivered to my room! The staff was very helpful when we couldn't figure out how to hook up the ipod to the dock to the stereo system. Honestly, we did not want to even leave the room because we were enjoying it so much, however the rooftop was calling our name! I love going up to Plunge! The atmosphere is very calm and I love the music that is being played as well as the view! Especially at night! I never noticed a sound problem in the lobby, the only time I heard the DJ was late at night around 10pm as I'm leaving and the lobby turns into a little bit of a lounge itself. I can not wait to return in March for my birthday, I am literally counting down the days!!! -Maggie

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: nicole4278
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Gansevoort in July 2011 for two nights for business. Upon checking in, my room wasn't ready (even though it was 4:30 and check in time was 3pm) so I asked to use the business center, which was off of the lobby. The business center was fine, but at 5pm at DJ started playing music in the lobby by the bar (this was a Tuesday). After waiting for a room for over an hour, I finally was able to settle in. The room I was in (a suite) was nice. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was large and nice and the couch in the living room was comfortable to sit on. I ordered room service for dinner that night and the steak was very good and room service prompt. The location of the hotel can't be beat. It only took me 30 minutes to get from La Guardia, has great cobblestone streets nearby and some good restaurants. Granted, I didn't get out much to explore since I was working, but I could see the location being a reason why someone vacationing would stay here. Generally, my impression of the hotel is that it caters to a younger, vacationing, socializing crowd. The roof top pool and DJ in the lobby really benefit this type of crowd. Overall, I would not stay here again for work as it does not cater to the business crowd at all. If prices were a bit cheaper, I would consider it for a vacation hotel; however, I prefer more quiet surroundings so I would likely look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great Location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: BrianfromBoston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NYC and an overnight stay at the Gansevoort in the meat packing district. The location is great - lots of shops, restaurants and easy access to the subway. The hotel offers valet parking for $40/night and it's about as reasonable as you will find in the area. The staff at the hotel was exceptional - from the doorman to the front desk attendants and the housekeeping staff - they were friendly and attentive and the service was great. My only complaint was the noise - inside and outside of the hotel. We were on the 6th floor facing west (9th Ave). I woke up at 1 AM to the sounds of a fight in the hallway. Security responded after being called but the commotion continued for about a half hour. Once that was resolved the traffic noise started - and from 2 AM to 4 AM it was like trying to sleep outdoors in Times Square. The street in front of the hotel (9th Ave.) is fairly quiet during the day - there's not a lot of traffic. The main activity on the street takes place when the bars start to close - there are massive traffic jams with cars trying to circle the block and beeping the horns continuously. The hotel could definitely use additional soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Alvin B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Sydney Australia. Spent seven nights at the Gansevoort mid December.Spotless luxury room, great staff, excellent service, best position in NYC. Room rates are so favourable my wife and I decided to return to this hotel after travelling over Christmas /New Year and spent another week here in early Jan. Had a reservation elsewhere but decided to return to the Gansevoort Meat Packaging District. Night life, bars, clubs, shops, restaurants, transport - all on tap. Will definitely be returning on my next trip to NYC in March 2012 Best kept secret in NYC. Please do not tell too many Australians about this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Utter disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jointfixer
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very excited for our New Years Eve trip to NYC. I love Exhale and sushi both which are located here. The kids were thrilled; they love the city and when I told them I reserved Wii for the room they couldn't wait. These things mean a lot to a kid. It finally did arrived at 6:30 on our last night of our 4 night stay with dead batteries and with only one controller despite telling the front desk we had 2 kids. It took about 40 minutes and 2 maintenance visits to get up and running. The fact that the room had peeling wallpaper, frayed carpets, and no towels in the bathroom was just icing on the cake. Each morning we awoke to the smell of cigarette smoke (on a nonsmoking floor) and no promised daily newspaper. On 2 of the 4 nights the room wasn't cleaned until 5 PM. Honestly I hate complaining but it actually became comical. On January 2nd the room next door had a loud party until 4 AM! The hotel is very unlike other the sister Park Ave location which seems much nicer. So much for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Late review but had to as Gansevoort was so good!”
Reviews.Author: TPL_83
Reviews.Content: Going to keep this fairly short. Was at Gansevoort over new year and attended the nye party there! Ideally placed away from hustle and crowds of 5th avenue. In a very cool area with some great shopping. Good clean hotel that simply had an air of coolness about it! Pricey but that's good as keeps a certain standard of clientel. Pool pretty chilly at 7am in winter! Thank you Gansevoort!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place for New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Rosenstok
Reviews.Content: We thought the NYE party at Hotel Gansevoort would be a great way to celebrate. It disappointed on several fronts. We had dinner there first, but the staff seemed like a bunch of chickens with their heads cut off. The dinner did eventually trickle through, and was superbly prepared, but the service and timing was so poor that it was hard to enjoy the dinner. It didn't help that they offered a choice of complementary champagne or vodka with dinner - since several tables went for the vodka and grew louder and more obnoxious by the second. The ensuing party quickly degraded into a bunch of too drunk people puking, falling over and in one instance, not able to hold her bladder in the line for the washrooms. Maybe it's unfair to fully blame the hotel for attracting the wrong crowd but even if there hadn't been as many overly drunk guests, the evening would have still been less than acceptable because of the poor service. Hopefully the staff are more capable in their daily hotel routines...

Reviews.Title: “Most personal service I've experienced in NY”
Reviews.Author: barbara w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live nearby but decided to stay in the city one Friday night to attend a nearby work event. We were a bit hesitant to book here, fearing it might be one of the many "hip" hotels which were all attitude and no service. As it turns out, our fears were unwarranted. Upon check-in, I was greeted by a friendly bellman and front desk clerk, and soon shown to a room of the category we had booked (deluxe king). The room looked fine, with a decent view, but unfortunately smelled of smoke. I called the front desk, and was fortunate to reach Jacquelin (not sure of her title, but she was a complete professional in every respect), who apologized profusely, and promptly had a bellman come with a set of keys to a new room (which happened to be on a higher floor and farther from the elevator). No more smoke smell -- but as I am very sensitive to smells, this room unfortunately smelled more of air freshener than anything else. I was prepared to live with it, not wanting to make a fuss, when I received a call (from Jacquelin) asking whether the new room was satisfactory (impressive follow-up!). I confessed my sensitivity to the smell, and she said that she was just going to upgrade us to a suite, which should make us happy. Within minutes, she personally came to the room with the new keys (higher floor still...), escorted us to a gorgeous 1 br suite, complete with a bottle of proseco waiting for us in the ice bucket. she couldn't have been more apologetic for the inconvenience, and I could not have been more grateful for how it all worked out. She then gave us a brunch recommendation for the next day (great local place called Monument Lane) proceeded to make reservations for us, and we thought that would be that. But when we returned from dinner that night, we were personally and warmly greeted by Jacquelin, who escorted us to the rooftop bar and gave us two free drink tickets (what had we done to deserve all this?) We checked out the next day, leaving our luggage at the hotel when we went for brunch. While I was waiting in the lobby for our car, Jacquelin again greeted us, and wanted to be sure we enjoyed the restaurant she had suggested. All in all, we felt like her personal house guest. I've never had service such personal experience like that before, especially in a big city, relatively large downtown hotel. It's professionals like Jacquelin who help build brand loyalty. (For the record, we had spent 5 nights during the recent black out at the Gansevoort on Park Ave, and were ready to move in -- so much so that I just booked 3 nights with my daughter in Miami at the Gansevoort there!) On a side note, the noise was not a problem at all (as other reviewers have complained), and we slept soundly until 11 a.m.! Great mini-getaway which we plan to repeat soon! Thanks, Jaquelin, for help making it a great escape!

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ForestLau
Reviews.Content: Yes, location of the hotel is good. But if you want to go sleeping, please try to avoid this hotel. I'm staying here and it's 2 am, but the music coming from outside is so loud that you feel you are in a club. Called frontdesk manager Jimmy. I was told that because of a bar close the hotel. The bar is not the hotel 's property and they cannot control them. Ok, I can understand the hotel cannot control their neighborhood, but why not equip soundproof window? If you like clubbing ang enjoy free club music in the night, this hotel is a good choice. For me, just want a room to sleep, I hope to move out as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Staycation Destination”
Reviews.Author: ExperienceGalNYC
Reviews.Content: Before we moved uptown, in Manhattan's Upper East Side, we lived downtown and we sometimes itch to revisit our younger years. During those times, we take advantage of our 10 minute cab ride via the FDR to downtown and we regularly check into the Gansevoort Hotel in the Meatpacking district (3 blocks from our old apt)...it's the perfect way to refresh our soul and visit some of the "old joints." It's such a great getaway, we always walk away thankful for the experience. The rooms are well appointed (if you know which one to ask for...we have our favorite), the location is unbeatable (for shops, restaurants, clubs, lounges/bars), and the on-site premises are pretty awesome (including the rooftop pool, billiard room/loung on the main floor, and the rooftop bar/and on some nights club). As an added bonus, they allow pets if you have "little ones." We love this place so much that we not only stay there several times a year for weekend staycations, when we want to gift our friends/family for special occasions, we reserve a night or two for them at the Gansevoort (which always proves to be a HUGE hit!). Because of the location, the hotel attracts a somewhat "young" and "young at heart" party crowd (we are in our early to mid 30s), so if you are looking for a quite place (and trust me, sometimes we do), I would recommend Cooper Square on the East Side.

Reviews.Title: “well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Clive G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gansevoort over Xmas 2011. Great location and ideal fo rmany sights to visit including the Hi Line.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie186346
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gansevoort over the Christmas period . The hotel staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is situated in a good area for restaurants and bars. It's a lovely hotel in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynByte
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights the last week of December. We live in NyC but arrayed as a mini break away from the kids. Upon arrival the front desk was warm and friendly. We had the room right below a suite and it was very lux. Window seat and big marble table overlooking the standard hotel and meatpacking. We at brunch at Pastis 2 days in a row and taxis and subway both extremely convenient. We went to the rooftop bar and on a Wed night it was packed. If we were younger we would have stayed. A very lively young scene I that's what you're looking for. I remembered calling to find out where the ice machine was and them telling me not to worry and in 3 minutes- ice at my door. Turn down service at night was great and maid service in the morning was quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: mimroe
Reviews.Content: Loved the meat packing district like a village fabulous market great shopping even a german beer Keller great for a girls trip shopping food club whats not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Great location is only reason to choose Gansevoort”
Reviews.Author: smckToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Being located in the heart of the meatpacking district and offering terrific views across the Hudson from the upper floor rooms may justify the room rates and a choice to stay here. On the other hand, is it really appropriate for sheets in a higher end hotel to have holes in them and for room furniture to look like it's been salvaged from a dumpster? The lobby bar/restaurant is similarly depressing in its decor and atmosphere and the rooftop bar/club is unappealing in the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but no substance with uninterested staff!”
Reviews.Author: IEatToLive
Reviews.Content: Great location and facilities not too bad but staff were incredibly unhelpful especially the concierge when asking simple things like can u recommend a nice Italian restaurant etc! Just got a blank, snobby expression and in the end we just decided to do our own research without the hotels help. Also being unable to get a drink anywhere in the hotel on NYE was shocking. We were advised this was 'normal' because we didn't have a ticket to get into our own hotel and by this time they had sold out! You pay a higher rate on NYE and the hotel prides themselves on their excellent facilities but what's the point when you are told you can't use them!! Having stayed at Soho House just opposite this hotel on every other occasion in the city this hotel just doesn't compare.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and buzzing rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: littleswallow
Reviews.Content: A very cool hotel in a great location. The meatpacking district is always lively, night and day and this hotel is right in the heart of it. The rooftop bar is always busy with a changing crowd from casual sunset cocktail drinkers to hard core party goers dancing the night away. Beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms are kitted with a few nice extras (their own chill out CDs for you to listen to for example) but they are small, as can be expected in NYC. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE THE GANSEVOORT!”
Reviews.Author: Olivia F
Reviews.Content: 1. The hotel is located in the hub of NYC's best places to go at night and coolest fashion boutiques. 2. The rooftop bar/club is a definite hot-spot; playing a great mix of music with a really quirky crowd. 3. The service is second to none; The general managers were amazing. They were immediately responsive to every request and were on the whole a pleasure to deal with. 4. The concierge service was extremely helpful with sorting out the best New Years Eve ever and with providing us with interesting things to do whilst in NYC. 5. The bouncers, security and reception staff were really kind and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and can't wait to return! We really recommend it for a hassle-free, edgy and enjoyable NYC break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location Horrible Front Desk & Room”
Reviews.Author: RKON
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Location, Location, Location and everything else was Horrible Horrible Horrible. I stayed 1 night for a company meeting/party. Arrived on Tuesday 12/20 in the afternoon and valet parked my car and was greeted very warmly. Upon checking I informed the girl at the front desk it was my first time staying at the Gansevort and was looking forward to my stay there. Went up to my room and it was clean with a nice king size bed. I had to rush out for a company party and did not arrive back until well after midnight. The room was at 85 degrees despite set for 68. Ended up sleeping with the window open all night because I did not feel like switching at 0100 in the morning. The room was very clean but the sheets were ripped in my bed. WTF??? Woke up the next morning to watch the news and the TV remote was broken. Upon checking out I informed the Front desk clerk of the issues. He apologized and said that they will be taken care of. While waiting for my car to be brought around from the parking garage the night manager approached me and apologized again I told him it was no big deal despite it being my first visit at the Gansevort. He than apologized again that the Hotel was slow and I should have been given a nicer room than the handicap accessible room I was put it. I informed him that my colleague was upgraded and he apologized again. He handed me his card and said to call him and he will "make it up to me next time" . I was really pissed and upset that I was discriminated in this manner by the desk agent. I may be older but I am not handicapped. The icing on the cake occurred two days after checking out when I was alerted on my Credit card activity that showed an additional $41 dollar charge ( parking I assume) which was already included on my hotel bill. I will not be staying at the Gansevort when we have our Monthly meeting in NYC in January and I have already have told my colleagues not to book there but stay at the Standard which is close by. It is not worth the aggravation to stay at this Hotel. Why would I risk another 400-500 night for this kind of discriminatory treatment when there are so many choices in NYC. Now I have to battle them over a stupid 41 dollar charge over something I did not incur.

Reviews.Title: “Xavier is awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Schultzy96
Reviews.Content: Xavier was amazing!! Did his job to a "T" service wouldn't have been the same with out him! He made my stay as comfortable as it could be!! Best hotel I have stayed in... In the north east!!! Gansevoort rocks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highlight was Black Eye Pea sighting”
Reviews.Author: Dunecoon
Reviews.Content: The rooftop pool, which was the biggest selling point for me, was covered and tiny. Did not look like fun at all. Given it was winter, but other high end hotels have heated pools, this just looks very 2 star levelish. The lobby leaves much to be desired considering the price you are paying. Drinks were good on the rooftop bar but place got a little too crowded and dirty because people walk in without cleaning their shoes anywhere. Room was small but very nice looking. Can't complain much about the room considering the other hotels I've stayed at. Just the lobby, pool and amenities were fairly disappointing. I could have stayed in Times Square for this much money and gotten a much bigger room with a great view. That's what I'll be doing next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel in MePa”
Reviews.Author: Tonyspad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited HG on two occasions and enjoyed our stays. The lobby is fun and hip, while the rooms are large (compared to The Standard) and comfortable. The only negative is the noise from the street and other rooms late at night. While we love to party, we also love to sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location. Almost great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexAndNell
Reviews.Content: The staff are great. Anything you want, they can get it or find it for you. You cant beat the location if you want to check out the Meatpacking or Chelsea area. The rooms are quiet and you wont hear anything from the other rooms. The pool on the roof looks pretty relaxing. Having said this, its not a family hotel. The seating area just inside has a painting of a girl flipping you off with both hands while wearing a "NY RIP" shirt. I'm sure its very edgy, but mostly just insulting. The room temperature cannot be changed from 70F (my friends in other rooms couldnt change theirs either). You can open a window, but that only works if you are used to NY street noise. The rooms are small but well appointed. The lobby bar is really small too - better to go out to one of the many really good bars in the neighborhood. The restaurant doesnt serve food till 6pm, so if you are a visitor from another time zone you are out of luck. Of course you do room service or one of the great restaurants in the area. The french bar across the street has great seafood at 5pm (exactly at 5). Not sure if this is worth over $500 a night, but the location sure is great.

Reviews.Title: “A chilled place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneMannin
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the front desk at 1130 at night, after a day full of delays to be asked if it was ok if they up graded me to a larger room as i was staying for a week was a fantastic way to be welcomed! The room was brilliant, bed turned down a Gansevoort CD playing in the background and a glittering downtown view. The mattress was one of the most comfortable i have ever slept on, accentuated by super high thread count linnen, the big bathroom and generous robes are not something that you find in your average NY hotel. The rooftop pool and bar are a great place to wind down, and have exceptional views. The location is fantastic, close to the river and highline and amongst some of the best restaurants, nightclubs and shopping. Treat yourself and stay there, you won't regret it

Reviews.Title: “Fun spot in the heart of the MP district, rooms are clean and beds are comfortable! Rooftop bar has views of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Chris_helen90266
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel -they get the business traveler needs but it's not too corporate. Not as pretentious as the Standard! Walk right across the street to Spice Market, Dos Caminos and Patisserie. Small but workable gym is a plus as well as easy access to cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kikistreamer
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated a friend's 40th birthday in NYC and Hotel Gansevoort was our home base. Everything was top notch and the service was outstanding!!! A little pricey, but sooooo worth it. So much within walking distance regarding restaurants, shopping, and clubs. Plunge is fabulous and a great place to relax and enjoy a cocktail...intimate seating and great views.

Reviews.Title: “One of my fav hotels in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights over the summer during a business trip. The hotel was top notched on many levels! You cannot beat this location in NYC! It is right in the meatpacking district which is close to many great restaurants and shops. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooftop was beautiful. My room was spacious by New York standards. I will stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and very NY”
Reviews.Author: Olga V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern with very spacious rooms and superb service for those who prefer high service and no problems and surprises. The only thing that surprised me was that I had to leave rather serious deposit to make sure I would be able to pay for any extras. And no breakfast included but as I understood it is common practice for New York. It has good location. It has active night life due to a popular bar on the roof and you could meet a queue at the entrance. In general, good for business trips when you need service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Service, spaciousness and location!”
Reviews.Author: HungryPeople44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 3 nights at Hotel Gansevoort in MePa. Our room on the 8th floor was quite spacious by NYC standards, very clean, and not to close to the elevator (as I had requested when booking the room). A word of caution, there were waterbottles and energy drinks set out on the bedstand, and at first I thought they were complimentary, but I checked the mini-fridge price list, and they were listed on there at an outrageous price. (check before you open, or plan on REEEALLY savoring that $8 bottle of water lol. Our room was spotless, carpets, windows inside and out, linens, furniture, tv etc etc, not a speck of dust, or a single smudge on anything. The bathroom as well was quite spacious for NYC, and again was spotlessly clean. Now the best part of the hotel IMO: The concierge service. I booked this hotel several weeks ago while I was out of the country for work, and dealt almost exclusively with the head concierge Keoni Boyer. He secured us the best seats in the house(F109 and F110) to Wicked (which was sold out) at the Gershwyn Theatre on Broadway. Got us table reservations on Friday night to Chef Mario Batali's Babbo's Restaurant. Got us pre-theatre reservations at Eric Ruperts 3 Michelin star flagship restaurant Le Bernadin (see seperate review of the restaurants), and was able to recommend to us some lounges and bars that we'd never been too, that were absolutely perfect for us. As for value, I could never give any Hotel in NYC a 5/5 because they all charge so much, so 4/5 is my top rating, as the service and size of the room was superb! Sleep Quality was given a 4/5 only because we had an issue figuring out our in-room thermostat. It was broken, we just turned it off, so the room got a little warm during the night. This hotel is probably not ideal for families or people traveling on business, due to the nightclub on the roof (which was a blast!) but for a leisure trip into the city it's GREAT! Some of the other reviews mentioned the music from the lobby. Was not a factor for us at all on the 8th floor. Others mentioned waiting for elevators... I'm sure you have to wait for elevators in every building?! On most nights when there is a line outside to get in and up to the rooftop club, we were treated almost like royalty when we showed our roomkey. A gentleman would rush to go get us an elevator and tried to keep us seperate from the rooftop guests until we told him we were also going to the roof to check out the club.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JESSEHAWAII
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great has everything you need and a great location.I work for one of the most successful resturaunt club and land owners in the world.So it was close to work.workout area has everything you need .The pool was nice food downstairs was good enough.I like going places that people want and enjoy there work. Everyone engaged and seemed happy even with it being 30 outside.Being from HAWAII weather is hard on me.They have a ok office area to get things done in the lobby also and its free.There where only a few bad things I asked to have his new menu printed out from his res and the guy argued with me about him not owning it because he knows the owner.Person he knows was just a new manager.Also I had a fax come to the front desk that they never recieved for hours because of no paper in it .I have stayed here four different times two weeks a piece and have really no complaints things happen.I will see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to it's great name. Dirty & Tired all the way around”
Reviews.Author: MarkO95
Reviews.Content: The Gansevoort name has meant great facility, and fabulous all the way around at Turks & Cacaos Islands & Miami until today's visit in the Meet Packing District. From the moment you walk through the front door and are greeted by an obscene paint of women flipping the bird near the elevator bank, to the smell of moth-balls on penthouse indoor terrace the impression given is anything but a top shelf facility. The front desk staff friendly and professional. The pool table in the sitting area near the bar makes it look like a pool bar, and not a high-end hotel. Exhale spa was dark, with red walls in the exercise area and no windows, to a roof top pool that is heated but open to the elements for the winter. The restaurant was chopped and and average looking. One look around and we canceled or weekend stay [at better than $500.00 per night], The hotel needs a major face-lift inside [furniture showed it age, and the smell was a turn-off]. Huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: DantesMonteCristo
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was here on business, but what a time I might have had if this were a leisure trip.It would have been great to go and enjoy the rooftop bar on Friday/Saturday night, but as it happened this was a noisy distraction when I needed to be working/sleeping. Spacious, tasteful room and comfortable bed (I slept great when there wasn't a party going on upstairs!), my only gripe being the wet patch in the middle of the floor that persisted throughout my stay. Didn't care too much for all the ludicrously priced toiletries and fancy kinds of water dotted around the room, though. Service was reasonable, but you didn't get the feeling that the staff cared that much.

Reviews.Title: “Holy WOW”
Reviews.Author: mdygdon
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there this past weekend and couldn't have had a lovelier time. The staff was kind and gracious and the room was absolutely flawless. The location couldn't have been any better as we were right in the heart of the meatpacking district and rooftop bar/lounge was by far one of the coolest we've ever been to. I can't wait to visit NYC again so that we can stay at the Gansevoort some more! You guys will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are spiffy, service is iffy.”
Reviews.Author: AloeKeef
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Gansevoort at least 25 times in the past 5 years, so you know they must be doing something right. Itâ€™s not so much what theyâ€™re doing, because service has always been spotty, but itâ€™s more about what they did. And that was build a hotel with very spacious rooms, by NYC standards, in the heart of an amazingly fun part of town. Those two things are the real draw here. I come back here time and time again because of the roomsâ€™ size. The beds are quite comfortable and a â€œkingâ€� is actually close to a real king size bed. Funny how in hotels the standards for bed sizes completely go out the window. The pillows, however, are far too smushy for me. I need to pile three of them up to get one firm pillow feel out of them. The closets are a very nice size and so are the bathrooms. The one problem with the bathrooms is the scalding hot bursts of water that always plague me no matter what room Iâ€™m in. Itâ€™s like they do not have scald-guard technology in their showers. Anytime someone in the hotel flushes a toilet, youâ€™re going to feel a scalding hot blast out of your shower. This is a universal problem, and it happens A LOT. Iâ€™ve never stayed here and not had the issue. It really sucks. On the bright side, the water pressure here is very good. Toilets have these awesome ergonomic seats that I wish I had at home. Sinks and vanities are huge. Vanities have large drawers, and lots of them, to put your stuff in, which is good, because there arenâ€™t too many places to put your folded clothes (stuff you donâ€™t hang in the closet) in the room. The rooms are starting to show some age, however, and I think itâ€™s time for a renovation. The flat screen TV is one of the most embarrassing things this â€œhipâ€� hotel. My laptop screen is bigger than these TVs. And the reception on them is just awful. I know the hotel is in the midst of changing out the little TVs to much larger, wall-mounted LG flat screens, but they sure are taking their time. I was here in the Summer and had a room with one of the new TVs. It was awesome. But here I am, 4 months later, and the room Iâ€™m in still doesnâ€™t have one of the new TVs. There are no DVD players either (except in the suite or by request) and I think thatâ€™s really weak. The carpeting is showing quite a bit of wear and tear too at this point. The mini bars are okay. The dry stuff is kind of boring. They need to update what they offer and knock it off with the â€œmile highâ€� kit kind of stuff and focus on tasty items that will tempt me. The fridges donâ€™t really keep stuff too cold and they are pretty tiny and overly packed with items. The beer selection is weak. Either Corona or Heineken, both in a can. I think they might have Amstel Light bottles too. I hate all of those choices though. Especially when they are warm. Thereâ€™s no such concern about choice when it comes to water. The hotel offers like 4 or 5 different bottled waters in your room, along with some stupid â€œdream waterâ€� and an energy shot. The clock radios are old and outdated but do have a docking station for your iPod. The heat/AC controls are nearly useless. This is a very disturbing trend in NYC hotels. I have no idea why, but no matter what temperature you want your room at, you cannot count on the thermostat in your room to get it there. Youâ€™re pretty much at the mercy of the hotel. This is one of my biggest pet peeves in NYC hotels. As for the service in the hotel, it is getting better, but is still not great. Like I said, Iâ€™ve stayed here so many times in the past 5 years. I wouldnâ€™t say Iâ€™m a regular, but I certainly would expect that they would have my personal information on file, yet they ask me for it every-single-time. Its maddening. And they never ever welcome me back when I check in. On top of that, I know my travel agent gives them my preferences when making a reservation yet time after time I donâ€™t get the type of room (bed size or location) that Iâ€™ve requested. Invariably, I have to go through this dance where I check-in, go to my room, and then call down to change. This was a huge problem for a while when they kept putting me on the smoking floor. Oh they will never admit it, but the 6th floor is definitely the smoking floor and if your on floors 5 or 7, you will get smoky smelling air coming through your vents. You can request an ionizer but that doesnâ€™t really do much. Housekeeping is excellent and they do a great job of keeping your room spotless if you tip them every day. Well, you donâ€™t have to tip them, but they deserve it, so donâ€™t forget them. One of the most annoying parts of the hotel is the club up on the roof. Itâ€™s not loud so thatâ€™s good, but the elevators, especially at night, are often loaded to the gills with trashy (and trashed), overly cologne and perfumed club goers. On most nights, there are bouncers at the front door and elevator who treat you, a paying guest, no different â€“ or actually worse- than the club goers. Itâ€™s really disheartening. Almost forgot the pool. In the summer this is a nice option in NYC, if you can find a place to sit. Unfortunately, the seating around the pool is severely limited and people like to pull the lame move of putting a shoe or hat on a lounge early in the morning and then come up to the pool around noon, having â€œreservedâ€� their chaise. The lifeguard looks the other way at this practice and it really sucks. Overall, the Gansevoort is a great place to stay either for business or pleasure. The rooms are spacious and clean and have cool automated window shades that open and close with the push of a button by your bed (too bad they do not block out sunlight at all though). Service, like I said is slowly getting better. I think the front desk gets less and less indifferent I come largely due to the hotel losing guests to the â€œhotâ€� new hotels in the area (The Standard, and the Dream Downtown which sucks, by the way). Give the Gansevoort a chance, Iâ€™m fairly certain youâ€™ll like it, and itâ€™s much better than the newer hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: uris r
Reviews.Content: my friends and i stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and we were more than satisfied with just about everything. our rooms were modern and spacious, and had this fantastic view of the hudson river, really spectacular at night!! service was amazing, the night manager, JP, was most helpful and attended to our questions and needs right away. location is the most convenient to just abt good restaurants, shopping, sightseeing, etc. we definitely recommend this to those that are wanting to experience an extraordinary hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern and convenient, albeit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: CEBB
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night getaway with our 9 year old twins. Saw a bunch of sites then took cab to hotel around 3pm. Although we were early, front desk staff was professional and friendly. Upon arrival, they upgraded us (without us asking) to a (very spacious for NYC)-suite-that had an ensuite bedroom with a beautiful soaking tub and separate shower/toilet area (a sliding green glass door could close off the bath from the bedroom and didn't take up space that a swing type door would have. The bedroom also had a large closet, desk, Bose docking station and a bench at the foot of the bed. There was a half-bath was in hallway/entryway, living room with pull-out couch, table plus a couple ottomans and chair and a stepout balcony. Boys enjoyed the heated rooftop pool while we enjoyed watching them along with the gorgeous view of the city and the Hudson River. At one point, the bartender from the adjacent lounge (you can see into it from the pool area) came over and asked if we would like a beverage (it was early evening, no patrons)- loved the service here! Chelsea Market (great shopping and The Food Network) is right down the street, there was a convenience store and couple restaurants within the block. At turndown, received cupcakes and candy from local candy shop. All in all great 24 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay w/o Kids”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: There is not a more convenient place to stay for a party weekend in Manhattan than here. Located within walking distance to a dozen great restaurants and nightclubs, if that weren't enough, you also have incredible service. Every staff member is attentive to making your stay comfortable, from cigarette runs to fast room service, this place makes sure you are taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Must read fine print and bill - they like to OVERcharge”
Reviews.Author: TravelChiclette
Reviews.Content: Bathtub didn't drain which made for a terrible shower; Body Lotions and Shampoo appeared only half full, as if they left it for us from the last guest. The bar upstairs has a leaky roof, so while it's raining outside, it's raining INSIDE! Great location for this really fun neighborhood; However, read the fine print - hotel restaurant adds 18% gratuity AND leaves an empty space for the TIP PLUS the server didn't even mention it. It's insanely expensive We booked a room online at one price, but they charged us almost $150 more on my credit card statement for no reason. The staff, of kids, is in no rush to help alleviate the problem of them overcharging for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: nickcambridge
Reviews.Content: Great location - especially now that the High Line is open. Otherwise a perfectly OK hotel that seems more interested in its trendy bar brigade watch out on Saturday nights) than hotel guests. Reasonable value for Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Comfort in the Meatpacking District”
Reviews.Author: annpoole25
Reviews.Content: Room and bath were sleek, well-appointed, and comfortable. The rooftop pool and bar provide great views; at night it's a favorite with 30-somethings who line the sidewalk to get in. Guests go up immediately. The staff is helpful beyond the call--they used their own computers to print out a boarding pass and mailed back a personal item left at the hotel. Location is great for walking to neighborhood boutiques and restaurants. The entrance to the High Line is a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “had my 40th at gansvort”
Reviews.Author: steven r
Reviews.Content: me and my fiancee stayed for 8 days it was fantastic we have friends who live in jersey and in the city weekdays so they took us to all the good spots the staff were amasing they are so friendly its all about being nice to people and u will recive it back everyone of the staff were great from sam and the girls at reception to johnny and charles at front door lobby we will be goin back to visit are friends alot there and without a doubt we will be staying there cant wait to see all the guys again all our love stevie and maria liverpool england xxxx

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: msv19650916
Reviews.Content: I was lookinhg forward to stay at the hotel following recommendations from friends. Booked an average priced room for NY standards - described as a superior room ... - through internet. I got a lousy room, with a view to a terrace facing the air conditioning system and a sort of balcony from an adjacent room. Bottom line: we could not open window or curtains due to lousy view and guys next room would see everything into ours. Bathroom was clearly prepared for handicapped people. Moved to another room at an addiitional cost of USD 100 per night, plus taxes. This room simply should not have been maketed. I did compain about the room but they did not care. Rooms and hotel very dark. It seems they are more ficused in the bar at the roof top than the hotel part. Will not stay there and will not recommend it, on the contrary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: Having spent almost a week in the hotel, I can highly recommend it to anyone looking for an excellent, friendly hotel close to everything. Rooms are lovely, spacious, extremely clean. Continental breakfast was the best I've ever had, very friendly service with great attention to detail. The minute we walked it, we were given the most courteous of attention. Dont miss staying there if going to the Big Apple. Hudson Bay just around the corner so lovely walks also, jogging for those interested. I hope to go back. Oh check out the roof top restaurant and swimming pool with to die for view of N.Y. Maria (Martin) Dublin, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Disco Night from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Tom i
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews about the "scene" at the Hotel Gansevoort in the trendy Meatpacking District of Manhattan. If you are into lots of noise, Axe cologne and rooms that badly need updating..this is the scene. It may be a fun place to party, but might be wise to choose a hotel that allows sleeping too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corneliusfudge
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here as an alternative to our usual NY hotels. Area is great with a nice buzz. The hotel itself we found ok. having travelled from UK on a Friday we didn't appreciate the loud noise from the roof top bar at 3am in morning but other than that we found the hotel convenient, rooms ok, staff friendly. Would we return? Probably not. But we love NY

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pool etc”
Reviews.Author: DavidF2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice, decent free Gym, Free internet room helped me, especially after coming from Miami hotel that charged silly rates for Wi-FI..the service is great, friendly, relaxed vibe, didnt feel too super trendy as I thought it may have. The rooftop pool/bar is nice, having Lacoste next door was a bonus as well. A great choice for business travel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perryb1900
Reviews.Content: I was in NY late in August with my wife and 2 teenage boys. We chose this hotel because it is in a great location near many of the restaurants we like to frequent. Upon Arrival we were pleased to have been provided with a goody bag for each of my two boys. Kids enjoyed the pool and I would highly recommend the hotel for families with teenagers. Our delux room was large and we quite liked the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: majmomrm3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the choice of my daughter to celebrate her 25th birthday! It was wonderful. I can't say enough about a few things....the beds, "perfect", they were sooo delicously cozy and comfy. The staff....professional and friendly and "on top of things." They keep an eye on everything. The location, we have been to many areas of Manhattan and this was nice for a change, we are usually in Time Square area and this area was "more dignified" so to speak. The pool, my younger daughter loved it....swimming at 9-10 at night, looking over the city lights of NYC, she'll never forget it. The lounge upstairs.... my daughter celebrated up there with friends and LOVED it, the music was great, the crowd was nice and she felt special when she showed her room card to cut the long line of people waiting to get it (they must have heard it was her birthday--hehehe) All in all, loved it so much, Magnolia Bakery just down the street, Bleeker Street and all the bustling and energy very close. Have fun, splurge and stay here....be good to yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but good location”
Reviews.Author: Animaldoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel before we left for upstate NY for a wedding. It was more expensive than usual due to an event, but I was disappointed with the caliber of hotel for the price. It is in a great location, perfect for walking to many great restaurants, bars, and the chelsea market, but was very loud at night. The bed was very comfortable, the service was great, but the other amenities were average for a hotel marketed as luxury. I think this hotel would be perfect for young adults in the area to party.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: californialovesu
Reviews.Content: This is a very trendy, young minded hotel. That said they were quite nice to us since we don't fit that description and we come with kids. There were issues that I don't feel comfortable going into because the front house manager did a bang up job of making things right with us. But I will say the suites are really terrific, whom ever designed them did a super job. Every room has a large closet, ample storage. The bathroom tub was deep and luxurious. Beds/linens are wonderful We did ask for a suite at the far end away from noise and we didn't hear anything. I do wish the room service could've been faster. Some nights we waited for almost an hour for a bucket of ice...that was a drag. Other than that, this hotel is run by some of the best in the business, and might you have a problem it will be fixed, somehow. And I appreciate that. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend shopping holiday”
Reviews.Author: kaybar007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in July with a girlfriend on a shopping/eating/cocktail tour of lower Manhattan and used the hotel as a base to explore Brooklyn and even Queens (PS1 at Moma - highly recommend a trip). The room had two double beds with high thread count sheets, a good size bathroom, a docking station for iPhones/iPods and a small outdoor balcony to watch the world go by. The hotel bars and restaurants were all without fault, and the pool was a bonus when the mercury kept climbing (esp with jetlag as coming from London we were wide awake at 7am, so after breakfast grabbed a spot before the pool got busy). The poolside bar cocktails weren't as good as the ones on the ground floor - a combo of plastic martini glasses and the huge demand. Oh and the DJ on the 4th of July night was terrible (or is all mainstream music in the US like that??) Apart from that, would stay here again as it's close to lots of the best of NYC - including the High Line and The Standard Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds and pillows ever”
Reviews.Author: Cuisineists
Reviews.Content: Contemporary chique hotel suited for couples more so. I ran into a couple of issues with my first room but management was eager to make things right. Service was impeccable, rooftop pool was small but amazing! Lounge chairs were very comfortable, wooden chairs with great padding and plenty of towels. Great views from rooftop, great service, great nights sleep. Nice spa and fitness as well as primo hair salon offering services within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: dutchexpat
Reviews.Content: Very nice area of New York, good restaurants in a walking distance but also shopping andn sight seeing is around the corner. De hotel room was nicely equiped, good bed and for NY understandings not too small, the only thing which was annoying was the air conditioning installation on the roof immediately outside the window which made a lot of noise ) ask for a higher floor'. DonÂ´t forget to visit the trendy bar at the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, sleek, in a great location! DefInitely for the 20/30 something crowd”
Reviews.Author: lauren1011
Reviews.Content: Ok so I now have 2 favorite hotels in NYC. The location is fantastic! Close to bars, shops, and restaurants. There is a great club always with a line out the door located in the hotel and as a guest you get in very easily. Free Internet is offered in the lobby. The front desk people are awesome and you can score a room upgrade for a very good price. Room service was excellent and I love that they offer the menu from the sushi restaurAnt located in the lobby in addition to the regular menu. As far as noise goes, there was one time I was in a suite and it was so loud and I couldn't sleep worth a damn. They were so gracious and quick about putting me in a quieter, even nicer suite. The rooms are fresh, bright, big and modern. The art on the walls give off a rather erotic vibe which is only enforced by the huge mirrors next to the bed and the giant windows. It's a sexy place :) Everytime I went in the lobby I saw fashionistas, jet setters, Europeans, and a generally high end, good looking, young or young at heart kinda crowd. Let me put it this way: if you are 42 and celebrating your 15 year wedding anniversary, this is NOT FOR YOU. Refer instead to my review of Trump Soho. There is a definitive party-trendy ambience and if that's not what you are looking for, you will be disappointed. They do their best to accommodate but it's gonna be loud at midnight. You won't notice however, because you will be at the club contributing to the noise. Have a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel - the negative reviews are way off!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights/4 days with two young kids and loved everything about this hotel. Staff was young but friendly. Vibe was hip but not too cool. Accommodations were small but great. Some furnishings are just starting to show wear and tear but the location is fabulous! The pool area and rooftop bar are small but comfortable. Great people watching if you're looking for free entertainment. All restaurants are expensive but worth it and there are many other places to go nearby if you go that route. I booked through Magellan Vacations who claim their rooms are booked directly through the hotel unlike hotels.com, which they said may contribute to nicer accommodations. The neighborhood is charming and an $8.00 cab fare away or subway 1 block away. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever”
Reviews.Author: jcp48
Reviews.Content: Manhattan and scorching 100 degree heat is not the ideal combination, but the Gansevoort remained "cool' ....as always. The service, food, and ambience was right on target. I've stayed here many times....and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Top NYC location, too bad about the club on the rooftop”
Reviews.Author: yves_alexis
Reviews.Content: First of all, a big thank you for the honesty of the staff working at the hotel; we forgot a large sum of $ in the room upon check-out and received it back after discovering our loss three days later. Hotel is very well placed, good food, rooms are ok. Our Manhattan suite had a lousy sofa bed, unsuitable for decent sleeping. The club on the rooftop attracts a noisy, uninteresting and unsophisticated crowd. Pool is saturated with house music day and night and not a place to relax after a long day walking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “In need of Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Deven T
Reviews.Content: I liked the location & amenities of The Gansevoort Â This hotel is popular & busy. Trendy style but it needs some attention. The rooms smell musty. Â Hall & room carpets are worn & dirty & need to be replaced. Â Some of the furniture is worn out chipped etc. Bathroom sinks need caulking. Â Bed sheets were not comfortable. The gym is in a dark basement, spa locker room was not comfortable or clean. Would not return or recommend this hotel until they work on renovating & upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “Not five star.”
Reviews.Author: Galubushka
Reviews.Content: Hotel furnishings are well past their best. Calls to room service would go to voicemail! When I called housekeeping and said "I'd like my room cleaned", it meant "now", not "at some point, today". This was not understood, there. Good luck trying to close the window once opened. I nearly broke my hand on the useless old handle. I could have used a hammer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, but cleaning standard could be better!”
Reviews.Author: furija_666
Reviews.Content: Lovely people at reception, room service and roof bar. We so much enjoy our stay. Just for future reference you should look at cleaning standards in the hotel, as property absolutely lovely, but it can't survive without looking after.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful people”
Reviews.Author: bobbylupo
Reviews.Content: We went for an overnite refresher from CT. It felt like we were in a small city with Greenwich villiage nearby. Cobblestone streets, cool restaurants with open storefronts. It was like being in Europe. Being a guest at the hotel gets you ahead of the line. This place is a popular hangout during the day with the rooftop pool and at nite as a rooftop bar. very cool. Definitely will be back .Everyone here was better looking than the other.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place”
Reviews.Author: newharp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a trip I won from a television network. I was unfamiliar with the Meatpacking District, but I loved that I have discovered it now! This property is very hip, and I'm really not, but that said, I didn't feel uncomfortable in the least. Check in went mostly smoothly, although I've never been a guest at a hotel where there was a third-party payer. There was a bit of confusion at the front desk and the host called the travel arranger and all was straightened out. The room was on the front side of the hotel, just across the street from Pastis, a really great place to eat. We had a room with 2 queens which is what I had requested since we were two friends traveling together. The hotel's "signature" color is purple, so there was a lot of that. I found the reading lights by the bed to be rather inefficient, but then again, I have middle-aged eyes and this is a funky place. The bed was comfy with lots of pillows. There was an in-room safe. The closet was spacious, with plenty of hangers for 2 women's clothes. They provided complimentary slippers. We got turn-down service only one night (out of three), so I don't know what's up with that. The room seemed clean and well cared-for. The bathroom was perfect for 2 women. We had LOTS of stuff - products, hair supplies, etc etc. A large vanity area held a lot, and there were 2 spacious drawers for the electrical equipment (dryers, curlers, etc). The water pressure in the shower was great. I always travel with a small power strip, and I'm glad I had it, because there weren't nearly enough outlets, nor were they conveniently placed. The only mirror in the room was a full sized one on the wall, right next to a bed. There was no way to see a full length reflection and there was no place other than the bathroom to have a mirror to put on make up, not convenient when you have 2 women trying to get ready at the same time. The concierge was very helpful in procuring some show tickets and restaurant reservations (and cancelling one for us). There is a VERY popular rooftop bar which we only visited one afternoon, and we didn't even get a drink. When we came back to the hotel at night, there was always a line up of people to get in the hotel to go up to the bar. We were able to go to a separate door and get right in by showing a key. I wish there had been a separate elevator for the bar, as once you're on the elevator, you can stop at any floor, which is a little concerning, safety-wise. That said, there was always a big guy by the elevators, and it was nice that only guests are allowed to hang out in the smallish lobby bar area. This is a great part of town that I'd like to explore more and I'd stay here, even on my own dime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, rooftop pool not restricted to guests”
Reviews.Author: Travel1UnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the rooms are a fair size. It's great to be able to skip the queue for the rooftop bar. However, although the very small rooftop pool is meant to be for guests only, on both days we were there local members of the public were allowed in - not good when beds are so limited. Also the lift to th rooftop bar doesn't go direct so non guests have access to the room corridors. I wouldn't have felt safe if I was alone

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: CJKNYC
Reviews.Content: Living in the suburbs of NY I chose the Gansevoort for a girl's reunion weekend. Friends flew in from around the country for this very special and rare gathering and I wanted a fabulous hotel. Our stay was a complete disappointment from check-in until the very end. While mgmt. did make efforts to make up for the miserable experience (sent champagne to room and took money off of our bill) that did not change the fact that the service was completely sub-par. Some examples of the issues we experienced: -tried to check us into the "smoking floor" and then took 2 hours to get us into another room when I insisted we have non-smoking -had to call multiple times for ice delivery to room (never came on first call) -had to call multiple times for engineer to investigate AC (the room was 78 degrees at its coolest- granted hottest wkd in history of NYC)- engineer said he would bring fan and never did -they were out of towels for upstairs pool. Not a huge miss because while we waited for towels I read online that their pool is rated one of the filthiest in Manhattan. -door man literally shoved me out of the door way when coming in that night, very rude It almost seemed as if their brand is centered around their trendy reputation vs hotel service....perhaps senior management should read "The Ritz Carleton Way"!!! I would never recommend this hotel nor spend a dime in any of their restaurants or clubs again. I was completely embarrassed to have chosen such a horrible venue and in the future will do much more research ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. Great service, Great location & Fun.”
Reviews.Author: cydb
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about the quality of the people at the hotel after reading some of the reviews, but am glad I decided to stay here anyway. My 2 girlfriends and I went there to celebrate a friends bachelorette, and we had a blast. The concierge was quick and helpful with booking all the great restaurants for us before we arrived. I was able to check in at 830am which was amazing since I just flew in on a red eye and able to get some sleep before my friends arrived. When I went to the room and saw there was construction right outside, I called down to frontdesk and they apologized saying it had just started yesterday and weren't sure which rooms were affected and moved me to another room on the other side of the hotel right away. Most of all, the location is amazing. Great shopping, restaurants, and nightlife in the area. We also had fun at the rooftop pool and club. Sure there were some greasy people there, but it was a good mix of different people and certainly a fun crowd. I also liked that they were really strict about only letting hotel guests by the pool, so it wasn't hard for guests to find a seat. I would definitely go back again and recommend to anyone looking for a fun time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Spankytoes
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was clean. The rooms were a nice size and the bed was very comfortable. The subway is only a few minutes walk. The front staff was excellent. However, the security left a lot to be desired. I was required to show my room key every time I arrived/departed the hotel to ensure that I was a guest. (Despite it being the same guy all 3 nights. We had met.) There isn't a ton to do or eat in the area. Some local diners and off-beat food choices. The rooftop bar is pretty cool and the gym was a nice touch. The hotel caters to luxury...and it reflects in the price. Honestly, I would pay $100 less to stay in a more conveniently situated hotel closer to the tourist spots. Don't get me wrong, the hotel itself was fine. I just don't see where the value is.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing third time around.”
Reviews.Author: MJMSurrey
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm getting older but the Gansevoort has lost some of its shine since our last visit. At weekends the roof top bar areas are a scrum, as NYC's 20-30 somethings arrive in their droves, leaving little or no space for guests. If you manage to get a seat the price of a drink will soon have you leaving the building to discover cheaper and more friendly watering holes in the Meatpacking District.The service at this rooftop bar is rushed and unfriendly. If you do have more money than sense, and it is in a fantastic location, ensure you get a room high up - we were on the 10th Floor - with a Hudson River view. Amazing for sunsets.The rooms are very comfortable but not grand. The beds, solid and relaxing. The doormen were the most helpful of all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay for business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: JD419
Reviews.Content: The Gansevoort has a small bar inside and a great patio for people watching. Coffee in the morning was perfect! Tanuki Tavern is a roof top, get there relatively early as by later in the evening, the line up is out the front door. Might be different for guests. Pricey drinks but a very unique atmosphere. The meatpacking district is a great place to stay, lots of activity close, handy to the train and an inexpensive cab ride if you want to go to the theatre or financial district. Also a very interesting walk to the Village or the Theatre. Busy area for night life in the hotel and nearby properties. Check out the High Line, a former railway now an above ground walkway through Chelsea area.

Reviews.Title: “Sick”
Reviews.Author: dhmills
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. It is in an unreal location and has a few fun bars/restaurants in it. Only issue is that the bar up on the roof uses the same elevators as hotel guests - this is a bad call, and something the Standard Hotel got right. This can lead to late-night elevator issues and noise. Rooftop pool is incredible and makes up for the lack of private elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: jbsalee
Reviews.Content: We asked for a Grand Deluxe King Room and even talked about which ones were the best. We were given room 1106. Unfortunately it had a connecting door and paper thin walls! We could hear our neighbors every day for 3 days. When we were woken up at 4 am we asked to change rooms. Luckily, we were accommodated.but we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Hotel in trendy Meatpacking district”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsPeter
Reviews.Content: A great place to enjoy the trendy and busy life in the Meatpacking District. The hotel has a intimate pool on the roof with great views, although it becomes a too crowded area at night. Comfortable, but expensive rooms ( rather small). You are close to excellent shops and restaurants. A special touch in New York.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a cool part of NYC”
Reviews.Author: StreamsUK
Reviews.Content: This is a great, contemporary hotel in the Meatpacking District, surrounded by converted warehouses and set amongst cobbled streets near the Hudson River. This is a seriously cool part of NYC. The hotel itself has great rooms, a funky rooftop pool and bar and a quieter bar and coffee shop on the ground floor. It can get noisy at night and the beat of the music from the rooftop bar resonates throughout the hotel, but don't let that put you off as it's quiet after 4.00am! Seriously though, it was a great place to stay and we'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: JMBPDX
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to NY for work every few weeks and this was a recommendation from some colleagues. To say the least I was very disappointed, especially based on rate. Upon arrival there was a long line with only two people behind the desk so waited over 20 minute to check in. When I finally did get up to the desk they were actually very rude. I had reserved a king room, but was given a room with two queens. The beds were comfortable, but the sheets were very scratchy. After my day at the office I came back and both my cards did not work, when I went back downstairs to get them reactivated they told me to 'keep them away from credit cards'. Both cards were in different places in my purse, neither by credit cards. And to top it all off in the middle of the night my balcony door blew open! There was a storm with winds blowing but still, just tells me the latch is not good. Glad I was on the 12th floor or it really would have freaked me out. With all the choices in NY, I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the hotel has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Victoriam31
Reviews.Content: The Gansevoort in Meatpacking has to be in one of the City's top location for nightlife. The area is packed with the city's best/trendiest restaurants and clubs. The hotel itself, however, has seen better days. The exterior and interior are in need of some TLC. Although it's not terrible, the furniture looks beat. There are permanent water stains on coffee tables and you can sometimes see razor blade cuts on furniture from one too many late night parties. In general, rooms look far better under the cover of night than when you wake up in the morning. The most disappointing part was the Concierge. Part of the beauty of staying in a hip hotel is that the Concierge should be able to make an extra effort to get you a reservation just about anywhere you like. This one was a dud. I was simply asking for a reservation at a lounge (where I've been a 100 times before) for 4 people... and this was not a new place, so it should have been a snap. Instead, I got a hundred excuses as to why he couldn't make it happen. If that's the case, I think they need to rethink their Concierge position. Additional notes: bed was very comfortable. Room service took forever and the sushi at Tanuki Tavern was terrible. Don't even bother! Internet connection was super weak. The pull down shades were not very dark when morning came around. Bring your eye mask or wake up earlier than you intended. Overall, I would say, this was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LD73
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when booking this hotel due to the negative reviews on noise and club-like feel. I must say I enjoyed staying at the hotel. The location can't be beaten: in the meat packing district and close to Chelsea and the village. Yes, it's a bit noisy with all the hooting and sirens but this is NYC after all. The double glazing does a good job at keeping most noise out. There are clubbers outside the hotel on Fri / Sat but it didn't bother me. Althought it would be nice if there was a dedicated door and lift for hotel guests. The rooms were large by NY standards and fast free wi-fi provided which is a big plus in my books. I had dinner at the Japanses restaurant downstairs and the food was delicious, highly recommended. I expected more from the breakfast though as the hotel is pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, AMAZING NEIGHBORHOOD!”
Reviews.Author: TChristy
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, staff treats you like a star and the rooftop pool is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a really fun area.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley S
Reviews.Content: The size of the room and bathrooms are large by NYC standards. Always love to have a bath robe provided and the extra deep tub was heaven after a long day of walking. The room service was fast and the burger was really tasty. Got a little "clubby" and crowded outside the hotel on Fri-Sat but the lovely bay windows sealed out the noise and the automatic blinds were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “I never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: worldTraveler2289
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and stay here every time I come to NYC. Location is in the heart of the most hip part of the city, the Meatpacking District. Neighbors the Village. So a perfect location for shopping and great restaurants. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. If you like the nightlife, this is the place to be...not only do they have a great bar/club on the rooftop but the entire area has tons of options. I also love the spa there! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jantie001
Reviews.Content: I visited New york several times now and I love to change location depending its trendiness. This time I thought the MPDistrict would be the place to be and indeed we loved the neighbourhood. A little vibrant/noisy during the weekend but we loved our short stay anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: kikivancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gansevoort in the Meat Packing District for 4 nights for a recent business trip. I was very pleased with everything about this hotel. Service was fantastic from the front desk to the chambermaids. The room was modern, clean, large for NYC, new, and had a very comfortable bed. The cafe downstairs was great for a morning coffee and the lounge on the main floor was nice for an afternoon drink.
