Although the wait staff service at the bar was not as good as the rest of the hotel. I did not use the pool or go to the lounge upstairs- I did take a peek and it looked pretty trendy and loud so I went downstairs. I also went the japanese restaurant in the hotel- it was very good. I recommend this hotel- it was my first time in the Meat Packing district (I have stayed in Greenwich Village and Midtown on past visits) and it was my favorite. Great little boutiques, fantastic restaurants (Spice Market!).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Great Quality”
Reviews.Author: rajazz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Gansevoort for two nights as part of our trip to New York Fashion Week. From the moment we arrived the staff team were simply amazing; as soon as we walked through the door we were made to feel welcome and at home. We received a free upgrade on our room which was spacious, extremely comfortable and very well arranged - good quality furnishings, impeccably laid out and clean. The service we received over two days was outstanding: exceedingly high standards of customer care with professional and friendly service. The location was perfect. A fantastic experience and I cannot commend this hotel highly enough. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home, Quiet, Large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: christineglick
Reviews.Content: The service is exceptional from the moment we pulled our car to the curb, the check-in was very polite and quick. Our room was very clean and had everything we needed. The beds are so comfortable you don't want to get up. The location is unbelieveable. Walk on the highline, enjoy Chelsea Market, walk to so many wonderful restaurants and parks and great shopping. The rooms are very quiet. We like the addition of the bar and coffee lounge off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, but tried to make up for it”
Reviews.Author: Damian35
Reviews.Content: dont get me wrong, the location is amazing, the room was ok-ish, but the staff were well below par given the price....and having a public roof top bar operating the hotel lifts is a big big mistake. We had to wait far to long for the lifts when the roof top bar was busy and we had to live with drunk roof top bar patrons when in the lift. The concierge was very un-helpful. We did send an email noting our issues and disappointment, which after a number of weeks was answered and the response was good enough......but no chance we will stay in this hotel again and would not (have not) recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if you need a gym and/or spa”
Reviews.Author: WouterinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not bad, but nothing exceptional given the price that you pay. Where you really do pay way too much is the service. I was treated so rudely while simply working out that I would not go back to this hotel if I could stay there for free, so unpleasant was the experience. This is what happened. It started while I was working out in the gym. An aerobics instructor parked herself right in between me and the tv, not caring at all that she blocked the view. It took a while but she finally moved and moved just outside the gym. But there she was still talking so loudly that I still could not hear the tv. Given that she was outside the gym the solution seemed easy, I closed the door. Then she erupted and started telling me that I couldn't close the door and that I was an impolite unpleasant person. And that in front of other people. Interestingly, only the aerobics instructor itself was disruptive. Her pupils that were also crossing the room actually did behave normally. The worst thing was that a bit later the director of the spa came to me. Not to apologize! No she came to me to explain to me that this (meaning the gym) was "a high traffic area". Well, if the director of the spa thinks you can just choose right in front of tv screens in gyms, then you know what kind of place we are talking about To be fair, it seems the spa is run by different people and the hotel manager thought this was not acceptable either. But still, I picked this hotel because I thought I could work out.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Sleep”
Reviews.Author: lattecoffee
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful. The rooms were a bit small. Now trying to sleep was a nightmare. There is a gap on the bottom of the door so you can hear everything in the hallways. The door has a spring on it which causes it to slam shut. So all night long you can hear doors shut really loud. It was virtually impossible to sleep! If you bring some ear plugs, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the level of service I thought it would be.”
Reviews.Author: avd59
Reviews.Content: Great room which we were upgraded to. Good views and the maid service was excellant. The front desk was not up to par and the general feeling we got was that no one cared much for the people they worked for or the job they had. Seemed that it was more of a inconvience than a pleasure to have guest. I not found a better room and bathroom in New York but it takes good personal to make guest feel good about their stay. I will go back to my other places. We try to make 2 to 3 trips per year to NYC and the personal makes all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dirty, Dirty”
Reviews.Author: nynj1985
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to be staying at the Gansevoort Meatpacking. Once I arrived was taken back by a girl at the front desk, not in a good way, luckily I wasn't checked in by her but the attitude that I saw she had towards her fellow co workers appalled me. On entering the room it seemed clean enough. However once settled I noticed the fingerprints all over the glass tops they had, something "sticky" that was on the out dated magazine and over a table, what I can only assume was a mold in the mini bar fridge, huge rips in the sheets that had been stitched and a used cigarette under the stained dust ruffle. The water pressure is more of a dribble, and the half used bottles of shampoo. Worst of all, I walked into the room as it was being cleaned and saw the glasses I used earlier being cleaned with a windex thisÂ really put a bitter taste in my mouth for this hotel. I can not believe how what should have been a stressless visit turned into a dirty rude mess. The location is great but I will be trying the Standard my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great New York Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marie F
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying at the Gansevoort several times for business. The service is friendly and helpful. The rooms, while they can be small, are well equipped. If you're able to get an upgrade (or pay for a bigger/better room) you could be treated to beautiful views of the Hudson. The location is great, just steps away from Pastis, Chelsea Market and the Highline. I have not recently taken advantage of the nightlife, but the hotel's top-floor lounge also has sweeping views. The room service is good and prompt as well.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: raphasaria
Reviews.Content: - First you wait 30 minutes before being able to reach the only receptionist for the check-in, who surprisingly explains you that rooms are not available before 3 PM (we arrived at 1 PM) but make you sign a paper for you to acknowledge that you will be charge if you check-out after 12 PM. Of course she did not proposed us to have a complementary drink / collation (not even to enjoy it at our expenses) at one of the various bar / restaurant of the hotel - At 11 AM, to get out of your room you have to make yourself a way around last evening dinner room service trays that are spread all over the floor in front of your room door (remains of burgers...). The smell was awesome... - Bath tube water was yellow (I don't intend to be vulgar, but it really looks like...) - The double size bed is even smaller than a queen size bed - When you want to enter the hotel after a certain hour (after dinner), a bouncer yell at you "room key!!!", no "good evening sir" nor "please" or "thank you" - A/C was not working - I have noticed the hotel manager of some of these matters but she did not propose any compensation despite asking me for the pictures of the drama I have. And you pay 600 USD per night for such a service I staid at the Morgan Hotel a week before, the service and room are not to be compared as it is so much better... for half the price..."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, marred by mean-spirited service”
Reviews.Author: nibster
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research on which hotel to stay at - we wanted to be in the Meatpacking District - and we selected the Gansevoort, even though I had read the reviews and noted several that commented on the service being inconsistent. This is a great hotel in a great location. The room was lovely, bed was really comfortable, pool on the roof was great, spa and gym were excellent too. The staff in the spa, at the pool and in the bar were charming and courteous. Housekeeping were very efficient. However... I have to sadly agree with the other reviews. One incident really marred our enjoyment - and it was totally avoidable and wouldn't have happened at the other hotels we've stayed in in New York. In our room there were several items with price tags on. We normally leave the minibar alone and buy snacks from a local store. There was no pricelist sheet in the room. We drank some bottled water which had no sticker on it, having assumed that it was complimentary, which has been our experience in other hotels in NYC, certainly in this price bracket. Later when we got a pricelist sheet we discovered that the water cost almost $10. We wouldn't have paid for it if we'd known. We went to the front desk to politely explain that we'd consumed it mistakenly and we didn't think we should pay for it. The context is that we spent thousands of dollars on our stay, and happily paid premium prices for dry cleaning via the hotel as we appreciated the convenience. We do not begrudge paying for goods and services. But we made a genuine mistake about the water, and we were surprised that there was no complimentary water in the room. The man at the front desk wasn't able to deal with our issue and said that someone would get back to us. We then got a message on our phone and rang down to have someone read out a statement from the hotel explaining that they would not refund us the bottle of water. This struck my partner and I as incredibly petty and upset us both. When we checked out no-one asked us if we'd enjoyed our stay and whether we were totally satisfied. Service on the front desk was efficient but brisk, and nowhere near as friendly as other hotels we've visited in NYC. Often the staff seemed in a hurry or distracted by something else going on. I like to feel that the hotel is grateful for my custom, and we both felt a little taken for granted. Having said all this we still had a great stay, and there was so much about the hotel to recommend, but we felt that the service kind of spoilt things.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep between midnight and 4am, DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: noodds
Reviews.Content: Who did these people pay to get a five star hotel rating? This hotel is very, very loud with pseudo "minimalism" decor. It was neither hip nor cool. Between honking taxis, the roof-top bar, and neighboring clubs, you are assured a loud, sleepless stay. We complained about the noise and were given coupons for the "free continental breakfast buffet". Are you kidding me? Is a bagel, juice, and coffee supposed to make up for two sleepless nights? We changed rooms three times attempting to avoid the noise to no avail. There is a reason why this hotel is so much cheaper than the real five star hotels, so beware! Skip this place at all costs just go the The Ritz, The Carlyle or the St. Regis (the real 5 star hotels). These hotels are consistently outstanding everywhere in the world. Yes they cost a little more, but they are absolutely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a great bar- the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: paulamcgy
Reviews.Content: I went here for the weekend with a friend and had the best time. This is a very cool hotel and bar. Overlook Manhattan while sipping a cocktail. Busy, lively and great for a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Gansevoort for Food & Wine Festival”
Reviews.Author: bakynmama
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gansevoort Saturday and Sunday. We were in town for the NYC Food & Wine Festival. We are all between the ages of 45 - 55 and I really didn't know if we were a little too old for this hotel. I have to say that the hotel staff was great. Always someone around if you needed a question answered and everyone was very polite. Guess what? We weren't too old. There were certainly a lot of young, hip and chic people at this hotel, but even up on the rooftop Saturday night, we fit right in and really enjoyed ourselves. Stayed on the 12th floor and the view was great! Our rooms were very clean, turn down service each night, which was very nice. Excellent location and excellent staff at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “smoke and mirrors”
Reviews.Author: Tripp21
Reviews.Content: hip? happening? no, not really- a real bridge and tunnel hangout. The hotel is going for uber trendy but frankly purple everything and boutiquified is so 2007- it is uninspired and poorly done. It already has a worn feeling of a project done on the cheap. The "scene" is sort of touristy and the hotel does nothing to insure that the guests of the hotel have a nice stay, you are just lucky to be able to hand with the trendy clubbers, even if that means that you don't get to sleep. As noted in EVERY review (damn, why didn't I listen!) service is terrible. Our $545 room was flanked by rooms rented to what must of been a Jersey cheerleading squad, I called the front desk a couple of times...nada. When I mentioned it at check out he said "Well, it is a happening place"

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, its great. Just don't stay in room 304”
Reviews.Author: Harbut
Reviews.Content: Everything you read is true, this hotel is utterly fabulous. Great food, perfect location and hip nightlife. Rooftop bar in particular is pumping. Just don't stay in room 304. There is an inter-connecting (paper-thin) door to the room next-door and if you ened up with a pompous, noisy, self-important & selfish person staying next door your trip will be ruined. (I feel like the guy was sleeping in my room with the amount of noise he made, maybe he should have been - at least that way I could have told him to shut up!).

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a nice part of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JoeCarota
Reviews.Content: Very well located in the Meat pack district just in front of Pastis (Perfect for a Sunday brunch). Everything ok except the service at the pool bar (no at all professional).

Reviews.Title: “Feeling the vibe of New York in a comfortable setting”
Reviews.Author: Aty12
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights (woman 48 with 19 year old niece). We had a great time! The rooms and especially the beds are very good and modern and it was very nice to have a (step out) balcony. Of course the hotel it is a bit 'a zoo', as said in an earlier review, but for us it was part of 'the New York feeling' to see the beautifull crowd of young people. Of course the pool was busy om hot days but reserved for hotelguest only. And on a rainy day we were almost the only ones in the spa which is also free for guests. The service was not 100% but friendly enough. And the neighbourhood is great. Many of the things we planned to visit (Highline Ballroom, Ground Zero Museum, Highline Park) turned out to be nearby and there were many restaurants ans nice shops (like for modern 'foor shopping: Chelsey Market and big apple store) 'but also normal supermarkets and postoffice nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a zoo”
Reviews.Author: roger31148
Reviews.Content: Looked for a hotel with decent rooftop pool This had it in spades but also had everybody under 25 in NYC there every afternoon &evening. From the moment we entered the foyer (by the way our room was not ready at 20.00) we were in a giant loud disco Don't stay here if you're over 35

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel but rooms need to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: CEALO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in the Meatpacking district with a lot of nice restaurants, bars and shops within walking district. This is really the great plus. The hotel is a design hotel but the rooms were quite normal american hotel style. For a design hotel I expect the rooms cooler and simpler. The furniture looked quite used and the carpet had a lot of stains (the room would have been much nicer without carpet). For the price of the rooms I expect the rooms being better in shape. On the top there is a great bar with an fantastic view and it seems one of the spots in NY to be. Especially in the summer it is very nice to sit outside. We went there every nice since it was such a special location. It has also a nice swimmingpool. However, the swimmingpool should be cleaner (especially on the weekends where the pool area is very packed they should clean it more often - equally for the restrooms). I would not really reommend this hotel to elderly people because the music is quite loud but for people who like a trendy hotel that is the place to be. We were there with our daughter and the swimming pool was definitely a plus for her especially when you are in NY in the hot season.

Reviews.Title: “Gansevoort - Too cool to be of service”
Reviews.Author: montgolfier
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel where I have been staying a number of times over the years. However, on my last stay, staff attitude was horrendous - hardly communicating, "entry control", arrogant. I still adore the location, the fantastic rooftop pool and lounge - however: prepare to look up nostrils. For my part, I just dont need this in the future..... plenty of other new choices.

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment...”
Reviews.Author: detulman
Reviews.Content: If you have read some of the reviews of this hotel/club, you probably already have an idea of the type of place this is. All "poof" with no real substance. My wife and I went with several other couples for drinks before having dinner across the street at the Spice Market. The view is spectacular from the bar deck. We all ordered drinks, and my wife's beer came in a chipped plastic glass. Was not really a big deal, but a friend brought the beer to the bar to have it replaced. The bartender made a face, and actually took the beer, poured it into another glass, and proceeded to hand it back to my friend, with the suds still dripping down the side of the glass. Real class act, right? I was there with other couples for someone's birthday, and really did not want to cause a scene, so with all restraint, I looked at her and explained that was not gonna work. She grabbed the beer, tossed it down the drain, and refilled it, handed it back to me, suds still dripping, commenting "What was the problem, it was a plastic glass!" Need I say more The crowd looked like a high school field trip had just let out, but it was this young, inexperienced, unprofessional, lousy attitude, wanna-be-bartender that really killed the moment. And since there is evidently no oversight on the staff, the criticism goes right to the top.

Reviews.Title: “used to be the most posh hotel in tribeca”
Reviews.Author: tomundtom
Reviews.Content: this used to be the most posh hotel in tribeca, used to be until the standard just across the road obove the highline directly situated at the hudson opened. I am sorry it might sound unfair, however everything these day regarding hotel must stand up against thestandard. rooms are modern and clean and have a nice view. they the have a nice collection of clubmusic cd designed for this hotel and a beolab soungsystem in room. the rooftop restaurant used to be oone of the most famous, directly looking down onto the meatpacking district and the soho swimmingpool. however again, clientel used to be interesting, now rather boring as the pack has moved on to .....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great. Bogdan is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: janesezLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times over the last year and a half - I was in NY on business - and it's been great every time. When I wanted company, I visited the lobby or the pool bar, and when I didn't want company, my room was really comfortable. Special mention to Bogdan at the front desk - he helped me work through a knotty problem - he's smart, resourceful, and incredibly helpful, and I really appreciate him.

Reviews.Title: “My number one preference for accomation in NY”
Reviews.Author: ChrFah
Reviews.Content: I love the meat packing district and the gansevoort hotel perfectly embody the ambiance and classiness of the neighborhood. The service was above average, both in terms of concierge services but also in terms of the patience it must have taken housekeeping to tidy up at room filled with one too many shopping bags and supplementary girl things. The gansevoort also offers a splendid roof top terrace with delicious drinks in the bar (we stayed on the floor beneath the bar, and our sleep was not disturbed by the music or good atmosphere on the roof), not to mention their roof top pool which was a pleasure in the mornings before heading out in the city for some more shopping. If I get to choose I would already be planning my next girls trip to NY and The Gansevoort would without a doubt be my preferred choice for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great nightclub poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggie_tweedley
Reviews.Content: Paid top dollar $475 a night average for a truly disappointing experience. Very trendy location in the meat packing district which was great but the hotel really doesn't live up to the location. For the same money I would say go across the street to Soho House which looks after it's clientele. Major downside here is service. They happen to be a hotel under a nightclub and guests in the hotel take second place. I had to chase for everything here as the rooms although nice you had to call for towels and robes etc. They should have a seperate lift for non residents who come here to party as getting in teh lift late at night with my daughter was a daunting experience with some of teh more bositerous clubbers . Really need to up their game here

Reviews.Title: “A cool destination”
Reviews.Author: abqtarheel
Reviews.Content: I choose the Gansevoort because it was the location for a family wedding reception, and it definitely lived up to the hype! It was well worth paying a little more for a Deluxe Room on a higher floor, because the neighborhood does get rambunctious in the wee hours. Plus we scored a great river view! We really enjoyed the great restaurants and shopping in the area, as well as the High Line. Room service breakfast was a model of efficiency, delivered in less than 20 minutes. By contrast, breakfast at the Tanuki Tavern took nearly an hour, with service that bordered on surly and entirely incompetent. Otherwise the staff was great. We had fun at the rooftop pool, where an amusing mix of deeply tanned, beautiful people, vacationing families, and garden-variety tourists like ourselves were seeking relief from the heat wave.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL GANESVOORT - DISGUSTING POOL FILLED WITH EURO TRASH”
Reviews.Author: ANDYKOBE
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room with a friend for July 4th. We were told there was a pool on the roof and that we'd have great seats for the fireworks. That was the main reason we splurged for an over over expensive room. The pool was filthy - I kept getting hairs of different colors as well as twigs and other crap on my hands. I didn't even use the pool the morning of the 5th because the thought of such a filthy pool sickened me. As far as the fireworks - we were moved away from our seats and were asked to buy at least $270 in liquor in order to get a good seat. I could not believe this. We got our seats early and then were rudely sent away. There was inadequate seating at the pool. I had to sit on the floor because all the seats were taken - from morning until evening.you had to fight for a seat. The pool was filled with people drinking booze even though there were children in the pool. All in all, this was a horrible waste of money. If you want to have a disgusting time, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, very trendy!”
Reviews.Author: SA25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in New York for a holiday and the hotel really made the trip as the area was very cool with fantastic restuarants and bars within walking distance. The rooms were spacious and very clean and the amenties were great especially the rooftop pool and spa. All the staff were very helpful at all times. I loved how there was so much choice for restaurants near by and the subway was also very close when going out and about. I would definitely recommend this hotel for people looking to have a good time and lots of fun, If you are looking for a more quiet hotel perhaps this isnt the one for you but for us it was perfect and I would definitely go back here!!

Reviews.Title: “Stress Tested And A Pass With Flying Colours!”
Reviews.Author: BOUGHTON1
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed our previous 5 or 6 stays at The Gansevoort enormously - excellent rooms, comfortable beds, great views and at the epicentre of, perhaps the most vibrant, and attractive scene in Manhattan. Superb shopping, amazing array of eateries all around, for those younger than us more night -life than you can handle, close proximity to The Hudson River and its attractive parkways, Chelsea Piers and the ground breaking High Line - a masterpiece of imaginative urban regeneration and renewal. Our 12 day visit in June really stress tested the hotel because one of us was not well and we had to spend lots and lots of time either confined to our room or within the hotel. The staff were so helpful and worked round us without complaint to service our room when convenient to us. We had lots of room service, all of which was prompt, well presented and value for money and the Concierge made helpful arrangements for medical care. There cannot be many Hotels in Manhattan that could make a difficult time experienced by us, as comfortable and reassuring as did all those staff at The Gansevoort Hotel. And if you are going to be stuck at your hotel for long periods, then lazing on relaxing loungers beside the roof-top pool appreciating the beautiful bodies all around and incredible views across The Hudson River to New Jersey, can't be all bad! To all of you at The Gansevoort.....stand up and take a bow ......you are stars. We Shall be back!

Reviews.Title: “Who is running this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: wasabiwabi
Reviews.Content: i'm sure it's not grown ups. i'll know next time not to book a hotel that isn't sure if its a high-end hotel (the prices sure suggest it) or a club for wanna-be hipsters. i chose this hotel solely for its outdoor roof top pool (it is the 4th of july weekend) and we've tried several times to go and use it - but its thigh to thigh on the concrete - what limited seating there is has been booked non-stop by 20 something tattooed BP's who are fond of physical displays of affection. The pool is murky with unidentified objects around the pool deck and used towels everywhere. The doormen/bouncers size you up as you walk in, making sure you are cool enough to enter. And don't think of getting a good night sleep. People come and go all through the night, loud and drunk in the hallways. The hotel elevators are the same ones that shuttle non-hotel guests to the rooftop bar/club and god forbid the elevator open on your floor at 2am. It's eye-opening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcp48
Reviews.Content: My tenth stay at the Gansevoort.....and it seems to never disappoint. From the redesigned lobby, to the wonderful rooms, to the professional, friendly staff - this hotel is among the best in the country. It's modern and hip, yet doesn't try to be 'cool'. It just is....!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and FUN”
Reviews.Author: HappyMom_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel approximately 12:30 pm. We were told our room was not ready yet, but we could leave our luggage (in a designated area). That was fine because we had plans for the day. When we returned, we were told our luggage would be brought up to the room. It took a little longer than we would have liked, but a very nice man Raoul (hope I spelled it right) :), apologized for the inconvenience. He told us all about the hotels amenities, which we couldn't wait to try. The first being their rooftop lounge and pool. If you want to get a seat by the pool, I suggest going early, because it gets very crowded. By 6:00 pm, the lounge (Plunge) was packed. A fun crowd and good music. The staff is very professional and we were always greeted with a "Hello" and "Have a nice day". A bit pricy, but it is NYC. Our room was spacious with (2) double beds. There was a small flat screen T.V. The bathroom was very nice but the overhead light fixture kept going out, which was a bit annoying. I'm sure if we had mentioned this to the front desk, it would have been taken care of. Housekeeping was always on top of things as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, scene and service; trashed room”
Reviews.Author: MARworld
Reviews.Content: Like this hotel. Love the service, the location, and the scene. They are super dog-friendly. Had a suite. It was trashed: cigarette stains on carpet, holes in carpet, and stains on shabby-looking furniture. This was not a cleanliness issue. It was a facilities upkeep issue. The hotel is showing some wear and tear, judging by my room. It is possible that they gave us a beaten up room because we had dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Modern plush, worth a go for the location!”
Reviews.Author: ChuckySwizzler
Reviews.Content: I didn't get a great impression on arrival at The Gansevoort. Myself and my partner had 6 bags between us and none of the bellboys bothered helping us, maybe they were busy but whatever, we struggled in ourselves. I don't usually need them, but the one time I thought I could do with some help, I couldn't get arrested! Not very good so far for a 5 star property I thought. Anyway, check in was swift and friendly and we were escorted to our room, with help!! Yay! I'd reserved a grand deluxe room with the family package which included cupcakes from a nearby bakery called Billy's at turndown and a lunch box full of treats from Dylans. This was cheaper per night than booking the room alone so check before you book. We did only received one cupcake throughout the whole 3 day stay. Had to beggar room service to be given another. Now I can imagine a family would have a problem sharing 1 cupcake between 3 or 4! So we gave up the idea that we would get a nice treat on the last day at turndown! The lunch box seemed to just contain pretty bog standard items from the minibar, that were never replaced daily. It was a nice touch to have some snacks without having to pay minibar prices but there are stores just across the road. The rooms at the Gansevoort are the hotel's best feature. I was on the 9th floor and had a great Hudson river view, slight spoiled by the building of The Standard hotel but don't let it put you off! Colourwise, they're a neutral grey with olive, deep red and mustard accessories. Dark wooden furniture and comfy chairs in darker neutrals complete the look. The bathrooms are cool in marble and stainless steel, not too huge but large enough. The beds are LARGE and VERY comfortable. The rooms are well appointed with quality amenities and brands you'd recognise, unlike other hotels. We had a comfortable stay. I'm sure the smaller rooms are just as comfortable, if you keep yourself tidy! The Meatpacking District is a noisy neighbourhood but it wasn't a particular problem. However, I didn't stay on a Friday or Saturday night. The rooftop pool is a great addition and it was lovely to be able to get into the pool in the New York heat. It was busy on an afternoon. The pool at Soho House across the road, that can be seen from The Gansevoort was very busy too so its probably a plus point that at The Gansevoort, only hotel guests can use the pool, whereas at Soho House, hotel guests and members are able to use their pool. The rooftop bar, Plunge, however is looking a little tired and definitely in need of a refurb. There was a queue in the street every night of people wanting a taste of The Gansevoort without having to pay to stay. There is a great view of the Empire State Building, however, there are certainly many better looking bars in NYC. The basement has a spa. The hydrotherapy pools are free for hotel guests to use and are a lovely way to end the day before getting ready for a night in NYC! Its definitely worth a stay at The Gansevoort to explore the Meatpacking District. There are plenty of bars, restaurants, the newly opened High Line park and also surrounding areas with plenty of stuff to do before you've even headed further downtown or uptown! With regards to the other local hotel options, its Meatpacking, its all expensive, its not good value, but The Gansevoort is definitely good for the lovely comfortable rooms, the location and the pool, just hit and miss on the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but looking a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: ChiTravelgirl42
Reviews.Content: I love the location of the Gansevoort in the meatpacking district, near great shopping, restaurants and nightlife. The hotel is modern & trendy, but looking a bit worn. Our room was decent size (for NYC standards), but looked like it had been partied hard in over the years. The carpet was worn, stained, and torn and the furniture was looking a little beat up. We found a champagne cork under the sink in the bathroom, which only solidifies my theory. I probably won't be staying here again, there's much better hotels for the value. Alot of the clientele staying there were "Eurotrash" types. Overall, we were pretty disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “how to be dissatisfied in NY”
Reviews.Author: menezes
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel focused in their bars ,restaurants and not on their guests,is better come here for the roof top bar than be a guest ,at night a crowd arrive here and as a guest you dont have any privilege otherwise you gonna be check all the time by security guys if you are a gest or not .For me they have to decide if they want to be a hotel or a party place , or advise that they are a party hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice, but the bar stuff is very rude!”
Reviews.Author: SarkitaG
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend went to bar upstairs to enjoy the view of the city and the music. How disappointed were we, when after second round of drink, the red hair bartender, refused to serve us drinks!!! She said that we are drunk and she can't serve us anymore. Tried to complain to manager didn't help at all! He basically said, that he can't influence anything what is going on at the bar!! WOW! What a help! I work in this industry, and our number one goal is customer service! Obviously this hotel doesn't care about customers from all over the world coming back!!!! Way to go!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2 bed suite at the Gansevoort”
Reviews.Author: Dunnman
Reviews.Content: I came from Australia to meet with friends from London Houston and Canada to celebrate 40th birthdays. We took a two bed suite and single queen room to house 5 of us. The two bed suit e was actually a one bed corner suite plus a queen with an outer door. It was a bit inconvenient keeping our front doors open without a latch to let each other roam...just one to note. Rooms are lovely. Queens are large with two large beds. Suite was small but was sufficient for us to group and chat. Location is amazing - everything you need right there for entertainment, food and enjoyment. Staff were very helpful. It's expensive and don't touch the mini bar unless you must as it will cripple you. We laughed when asking for a kettle (to make our own tea - being British) as they sent up a baby bottle warmer - but we improvised and were fine. The gym was nice but the spas were too cold. We didn't feel toooooo old in the top bar in the evening but I think the drinks helped. Overall, a great location and would stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but a little arrogant”
Reviews.Author: delanoSoBe
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room from 10th floor and above with view. Hotel is very modern ans stylish. On the rooftop there is a bar. Forget the service. Staff is completely incapable but very arrogant. They kept 5 tables for bottle service but nobody showed up. Other people had to wait like 1 hour... well, it's their money. Trays from the room service were eft on the floor for 2 days. Best thing is the rooftop pool - priceless to swim there at New Year's eve at 7 o'clock with Manhatten awakening around you. Good continental breakfast at the Japanese Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely swimming pool!”
Reviews.Author: PabloLH
Reviews.Content: Let me first congratulate the designer of the website. The picture showing the hotel is not showing the hotel where you go but something modified with Photo shop to add some nice looking things. The hotel from outside is not nice to me. The room we had was excellent, clean and very nice. The bathroom was good too. The rooftop swimming pool is the added value of this hotel as long as the location. The bar tenders of the rooftop bar were very kind. Check-in and check-out was done OK. I can say that being in NYC when the temperature was about 25/30Â°C, going to the Hotel fitness (excellent) and then going to swim and rest having a great view of NYC and the Hudson was one of the things I enjoyed the most during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible- problems from booking until check-out.”
Reviews.Author: pwrpuf13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel with 6 other friends. I booked two hotel rooms 3 months ago. One of the friends that I would be traveling with called the hotel about a month ago to inquire about spa packages to be booked in conjunction with our rooms. She found that only one room was booked under my name. I called the hotel and inquired and indeed, only one room was booked. We straightened out the problem and a very helpful woman gave me new confirmation numbers and a 10% discount. That was where the great service ended. We arrived at the hotel on Saturday, one hour after check-in. We were told that our rooms were not ready, but for us to wait in the lobby and they would be ready shortly. We (and by we, I mean 7 women with all of our luggage) waited in the lobby for over a half an hour, and were then given ONE of our two room's keys. We were told that the other room would be ready shortly, as well, and that we could wait in the room that was ready. ONE HOUR passed and we called the front desk to inquire. They said they would send somebody up with our keys. They never did. We went down to the front desk to retrieve them. By the time we had both rooms, it was 530 pm. That is two and a half hours later than check-in. We had 730 dinner reservations. We began to get ready and found that our TOILET BOWL was not working properly. Because we now only had less than two hours for 7 women to get ready for dinner, we didnt call the front desk to let them know about the toilet. Not only were we not offered anything for out trouble and waiting, but the staff was RUDE. When we entered the building after the rooftop lounge was open, we were interrogated aggressively by security to see our hotel keys to make sure we were guests of the hotel. The day we checked out, housekeeping knocked on our doors twice before 11 am to ask if they could clean the room. Check-out was at noon. It was not necessary to be badgered while we slept (in dirty sheets, mind you-- one of the beds had blood stains on the sheets). Lastly, in addition to all of our trouble, I now found two unauthorized charges of $75 dollars on my credit card from the hotel. I called them, was connected to the billing department, there was no answer, and was told to "leave a message at the tone". Not only will I never stay at this hotel again, but I will never go to their lounge again, either. They will never get another dime of my money.

Reviews.Title: “Too busy trying to run their night club and bar hotel guest appear an inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: ianx1london
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a couple of times at Hotel Gansevoort, first around Christmas 2007 then summer 2008. This has the potential to be a great place but based on my experiences is going down fast. Differences between the two trips were noticeable. Essentially they are too busy running the rooftop bar and their nightclub to care about hotel guests. If you are on one of the higher floors expect to be able to hear loud music into the early hours. The rooftop pool was one of the major attractions when I booked for the summer trip. I just did not realise I would be sharing it with the whole of Manhattan. As a guest it is very clear that you are an inconvenience to the staff, everything is too much trouble. At the weekends there is a line around the block of people queuing to get into the nightclub, hotel guests are supposed to be able to get around this. In practice on several occasions I had to wait while the security staff were busy chatting to girls trying to talk their way around the line. Nearly two years later this visit still resonates as one of the worst hotel experiences of my life. I love New York; right now I think it is about the best city in the world. It has some great hotels, many of which I have stayed in, sadly Gansevoort is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “a little bit different, a great location, a little bit of luxury, a little over priced.”
Reviews.Author: cjaymes
Reviews.Content: I thought twice about booking the Gansevoort, having read some of the reviews, however it turned out to be a great choice for our weekend break in NY and although a little overpriced, I would certainly consider going back. The hotel location is excellent, the size of the Delux Room is good by NY standards. The bathrooms are larger and higher spec. than similar hotels such as the W and Westinn. The standard of the bed, cleanliness in the room were excellent. Due to the public bar and club on the roof the hotel is not silent, however we slept undisturbed and very comfortably in a room just under the rooftop. The pool is a nice plus and was warm enough for a morning Swim when we visited in April, the spar and fitness room are really quite adequate for a weekend break. Free internet access also a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms an afterthought to the chic but overpriced bar”
Reviews.Author: ejs3737
Reviews.Content: The hotel and people who work there take themselves far too seriously. The trashy (loud, gyrating for sure, but trashy) bar on the roof is clearly the money-making center for the hotel. The rooms are tiny, the elevators crowded, the valet parking atrocious (45 minutes to retrieve our car????). I would not return. Yes, the location is terrific, but this hotel simply is not.

Reviews.Title: “So so but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Randiesel
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a stay at the Hotel Gansevoort. The Hotel is located in the meat packing district. Very chic, trendy, upscale area of New York. Upon my arrival I was greeted by the Valet who was very curt in assisting me with my vehicle. Not a very warm reception. When I entered the Hotel I was directed to the Front Desk. They were very nice and professional. Although my room was not ready I did have to wait for housekeeping to get my room in order. When I did get to my room I have to say I was not overly impressed with the cleanliness of the room. They have a glass covering on the TV Stand and underneath it was loaded with crumbs and other debris. That aside the room was very nice and for NY somewhat spacious. The bathroom was very nice. I wanted to get to the Gym right away and get a quick run in before Dinner. This was the BIGGEST DISSAPOINTMENT. First off, I had to wait at the Gyms Front Desk while the young girl was on the phone having a personal conversation, after she was finished she then took up a conversation with one of her coworkers. I was standing there for at least 5 minutes. Looking back I obviously should have interrupted to her but I was curious to see how long this charade would go on. Once checked in I went into the Fitness Center, which was very small. The cardio machines they have DO NOT have TV's on them. They had these old square screen TV's behind a glass partition which makes absolutely no sense. Most hotels now have the TV's incorporated into the equipment. You couldnt even plug your headset into the treadmill to hear what was on TV. Once I finished my run I then headed into what they call a "Spa". This is anything but. I used one of the 3 plunging pools they have and while I was in there employees were walking around, having loud conversations, one girl was mopping, etc. Once again, not clean either. Nothing like seeing a band aid in the plunge pool you are in. Water bucket for plants in corner, heaped on a pile of garbage. The Locker room is a joke. One toilet, one shower, one sink. A Spa is supposed to be tranquil, quiet and relaxing. By far the WORST Spa I have ever been to. I have stayed at Four Seasons, Ritz Carltons, etc. These places know how to run a Spa. The folks who were working this place, Im sure are very nice but have NO IDEA how to put people at ease and create that tranquility that you would expect from a 5 Star Hotel. I have to agree with another review. The Hotel was obnoxiously loud at night. I stayed on the 7th floor and at 1am the music was still blasting. $600 plus a night and not being able to sleep because of loud music is unacceptable. I like to have a good time but the Hotel must realize that the people STAYING at the Hotel are the ones spending the most money, not the twenty somethings who come in for a few drinks and shuffle along. Overall, the Hotel was just okay. I would NOT go back nor would I recommend this Hotel. When you spend upwards of $600+ per evening and a Hotel sets the expectations of being 5 Star you expect them to meet that standard. I stayed at the Four Seasons in NYC 3 weeks ago and The Four Seasons BLOWs this Hotel away. I would seek accomadations elsewhere. Sorry for the bad review. I so wanted to have a nice stay and was dissapointed on almost all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “It was a truely wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: philipb64
Reviews.Content: The staff was effecient, friendly and helpful. This is one hotel stay I would not hesitate to recommend. It's located in a trendy, cool and funky part of the city. I had a truely wonderful experience. You will too!

Reviews.Title: “A little dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Rees-Evans
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights over new year 2009/2010. Must say I was dissapointed with the hotel itself as paid a lot to stay here and expected it to be amazing. Firstly on arrival we were checked in as quickly as possible, not even given a brief overview of what was on what floor and even which floor our room as on. Rooms was a nice size and funky and housekeeping were good apart from us having very large holes in our sheets 3 nights. Rooftop pool was freezing cold, the room it was in smelt really badly and as the roofrop cover is a temporary one which is used during winter it let in a lot of cold air - we were in there 2 mins then had to leave - would probable be nicer in summer. Rooftop bar was terrible - next to swimming pool so again smelt really badly. Not able to sit down in bar unless you are buying bottle of vodka, champagne e,t.c which start at about 200 dollars. Didn't find the concierge service very helpful at all. Breakfast wasn't great. I wouldnt visit again or recomment this hotel (would recommend the standard hotel 2 mins away from gansevoort) Meatpacking distric is amazing - some excellent clubs and restruants (try pastis, spice market, the standard grill and stk) would definetley visit the meatpacking district again just wouldnt stay at gansevoort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: xaether
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gansevoort on a Wednesday and Thursday night, in a Grand Deluxe room on the 9th floor. From when I first walked into the room I was excited about my stay. The room was beautiful and spacious (admittedly a relative term in NYC, but still the room was plenty large enough for two people and very comfortable), and the bathroom was huge. In addition to the king bed and the desk area (free wifi!), there was a very inviting sitting area at the window. I also greatly appreciated that I could set the thermostat in the room to either heat or cool, and it did either one equally well. And I loved that the artwork was vibrant photos of things in the neighborhood, full of character, and not generic hotel art. The neighborhood is great, with lots to offer all different kinds of visitors. There is of course the meatpacking district with tons of hip clubs and restaurants, and the Chelsea Market is nearby, as well as the High Line within a couple blocks' walk. I also walked west to the Greenway, and took a stroll along the water all the way down to Battery Park. If you like walking, you can walk from the hotel across 14th to Union Square, or down Greenwich Avenue to West 4th and Bleecker Street. And of course you're close to several subway lines or cabs to get you anywhere you want to go. The private minibar was impressively well stocked, and room service options were great. I'm not much of a partier, but I did briefly check out the roof top bar, and it definitely looked inviting and like a great place to have a drink and check out the crowd. As others have commented, the beds are very comfortable. I also enjoyed sitting on the couch in the window and looking out on the activity of the neighborhood below. You can do quite a bit of people watching (even better with a glass of wine) from that vantage point. That said, 9th Avenue, which my room overlooked, is a busier thoroughfare than I would have suspected, and there is some street noise. It didn't bother me at all Wednesday night, but Thursday it was livelier (pre-weekend partying, I suspect), so I do have to dock my review a bit on sleep quality. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, and helped make my stay that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in trendy area”
Reviews.Author: tipperella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gansevoort for one night on business. We had a team dinner at STK and drinks beforehand at the Gansevoort bar. While I had a brief stay, I found the hotel to be very nice, clean, and comfortable. Upon check in, I was actually upgraded rooms which was great since I booked through a discount site. The room was in line with many other hotels in NYC. It was not really large, but was comfortable in its size. As compared to some other hotels, I did find it to be pretty quiet so the walls must not be as thin as many other hotels. They also offered free wireless internet with the room (usually around $15/day at hotels in NYC). This is great for business travel. I had an easy check in and check out so would stay again if I needed to be in this area again for work or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Meatpacking district-a bed to die for”
Reviews.Author: Shootingstar_8
Reviews.Content: If you want to be right in the heart of Meatpacking district this is your obvious choice. We got very friendly service from all of the staff even ahead of our trip. They have an excellent concierge service who helped us book restaurants. The hotel itself is a cool city hotel with a great roof-top bar and pool as well as a 24h gym that was very well equipped. The bedrooms are nicely furnished with a bed to die for. It was the most comfortable bed I have slept in and I am picky. Amenities in the room where ok and it was kept very clean at all times. The in room selection was great and the minibar unusually good. I would highly recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “This is a rowdy club, not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNNYNewYork
Reviews.Content: Not a nice place to stay. The entrance and lobby are packed with low-life twenty-somethings pressing to get entry to the rooftop club. As a guest, you have to push your way through the rowdy crowd and be confronted by bouncers full of attitude.The room was not ready on time, and the staff could barely care. The halls and elevators are packed to capacity with drunken kids, and my female companion was accosted and propositioned in the hallway. Noisy ALL NIGHT. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “All our expectations were surpassed!”
Reviews.Author: KennethBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gansevoort in New York's Meatpacking district to celebrate a family birthday. We could not have had a better time. We got upgraded to a fabulous room and from that moment onwards our stay was fantastic. The staff were friendly, fun and could not have been more helpful. We were staying with our two children (aged 9 and 7) and our dog. The Gansevoort is a dog friendly hotel...so friendly in fact that they produced our dogs own towel with her name engraved on it. My wife had an 'excellent' treatment in the famous 'Exhale' spa whilst the kids swam in the roof top pool. Room service was top notch, the views are fabulous and the beds seriously comfortable. All in all I could not recommend the hotel more highly, we loved every minute of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing to say the least!”
Reviews.Author: Kgs310
Reviews.Content: Alright so I don't know if they post the time of the reviews that people write them but I think it's important to note that I am writing this in the hotel at two in the morning. This is my first night at this hotel and I originally stayed here because of the great location. Although it is in a nice location, this does not make up for the hotel's many drawbacks. The rooms are tiny. If you are used to staying at hotels with spacious rooms like the The Palace or The Pierre, you will be severely disappointed here. Even though I looked forward to the more chic, modern vibe of the hotel I found that it was haphazardly thrown together and the decor looked as if it was under construction. The worst aspect of the hotel is the noise level. Of course if you enjoy clubbing at ungodly hours in the morning, you will not be bothered by the constant stream of 25 year olds screaming and jumping around to pounding music at all hours of the night. But if you are anyone like me you will find that the "hotel" that you planned to stay at is actually a incubus of obnoxious bouncers! Once again, this hotel can be a nice stay for some people, but at 2 AM, with my room at 76 degrees, and no end in sight...I'm transfering to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Kahrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and had good service all along. Nice view at the bar at top floor and a good party. Relaxing swim in the heated outdoor pool with city view. The SPA was clean and friendly people working there. Nice spacious room with the most stacked minibar ever seen. IPod docking stations with stereo and CD player. Good dinner in the asian restaurant. Perfect area for shopping and the breakfast at Pastis across the street was enjoyable. Dinner at Spice Market and sightseeing at the High Line park is recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Movie Star Chic”
Reviews.Author: TraceyM1
Reviews.Content: Rooftoop pool included not one but two bars....one you could swim right up to. Brunch buffett was complimentry and scrumptious. Not to be a name dropper but during my stay I lounged by the pool all afternoon and who went walking by me but Courtney Love! The uber party girl poolside she looked a bit hungover and had not a stitch of makeup on. Later that day I happened upon a public relations party for the NY Giants Football Team. It was taking place on the other end of the rooftop in the Lounge. They had the area roped off for the vip party they had HUGE security personnel at all entries. I had to use an interior elevator to go back down to my room and that required me to step just past the ropes only a few feet to get into the elevator and I was able to peek into the main party area. I saw a bouncer whispering to one of the party guests. I got a nod and the doorman asked me if i would care to have a cocktail with the sports club. I sure did!! So for a glass and a half of chardonnay I got to rub elbows with the Giants (it was a pretty quiet party and none of the real big name players were there but it was a blast to be invited)

Reviews.Title: “Cool, classy hotel, hip, spacious rooms with great views, and a dream team staff all make the Hotel Gansevoort a very”
Reviews.Author: CRW12
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in New York with our 18 and 21 year old sons. We all loved staying at the Gansevoort Hotel, which is in a fantastic area for shopping, art galleries, and restaurants. The rooms were spacious and super comfortable with bay window seating areas and great photographic views of the meatpacking district. Great art and magazines too. From check-in to check-out, including room service, the hotel restaurant, maid and doorman, everyone was a pleasure to deal with. Really, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “People and Pets get Pampered!”
Reviews.Author: CG926
Reviews.Content: My husband and I adored our stay in the Manhattan Suite at the Hotel Gansevoort in the heart of the Meatpacking district. We were in town from Boston and what a location! The area is full of restaurants and boutiques- so in the middle of a very cold January it was nice to be able to "play" in the area. As a past employee of a hotel chain, I tend to notice the little things when I travel and the Gansevoort did not miss a beat. In this trendy and upscale setting, the staff could not have been more warm and welcoming. We brought our 4 month old yellow lab puppy and they treated him like royalty. Be sure to visit the rooftop bar/restaurant -my husband and I enjoyed some pre-dinner coctails and appetizers- and then ventured out for the evening. The room was very luxurious- especially the steam shower! I would most definitely stay at the Gansevoort again and look forward to returning to enjoy their rooftop pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome staff and very trendy”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach07
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC with my sister for a girls getaway. We stayed 2 nights (which turned into 3 due to bad weather in Baltimore) at Hotel Gansevoort. It was amazing!! The staff was very nice. We got a great deal on travelzoo but it was for a king bed. When I checked in (early with no problem, at 10am) they upgraded me to a room with 2 double beds for no charge. Then all buses were cancelled on Sunday so I had to stay an extra night and they gave me the same room at the same price. They brought up free wine and chocolate. Great rooftop bar but VERY expensive. The pool isn't what it looks like but still nice. The only bad thing about this hotel is that the heat was very dry so I had a sore throat the whole time I was there. All in all, it's a very trendy cool hotel. great staff and great location. I would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dyana-N
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Gansevoort - the room size was very comfortable for the price ($239 a night). The bathroom was clean and modern. The bed is wonderful. I would order coffee in the morning and it would arrive within a few minutes. I stayed at the Standard during my last trip and I would definitely recommend the Gansevoort instead (they are practically across the road from one another). I did notice it got a bit noisy outside on Thursday night since it is such a busy area, but I was on a low floor. If you want to avoid the noise, I'd recommend you stay on a high floor. Other than that, its really great!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the Meatpack!”
Reviews.Author: Fashiongrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Gansevoort, after staying 10 days at the Standard hotel, where the service is terrible! The service at the Gansevoort is just the best. The whole staff is always smiley and happy. The room is impeccable, nothing to say, especially when you are a maniaque person like me. They even offer you gifts everyday in the room, which is kind of unusual. You have a great spa as well, with a hairdresser and work out classes. I really appreciated my stay and definitely recommend this place. It's in a perfect location, walkable area, in the heart of the hipest places. Do not hesitate to choose this hotel if you want to stay in the Meatpacking district. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: avanderschaft
Reviews.Content: I read that this was the place to be in the Meatpacking district. We LOVED the area, really cool but the hotel... The room was ok, nothing special. We had a nice view during the day but then it turned to night. MY GOD, the noice. We didnt sleep 1 evening before 3.00pm. The isolation of the hotel was so bad, you could hear EVERYTHING! And I know NY is not a quiet city but this was abnormal. Then also we found out the hotel bar was closed. They did not inform us when I booked the room. Overal the service, the accomodation was certainly not up to the standard you should expect from a hotel like this. The cheapest room is $315 ex cl tax or breakfast. To my opinion, not worth it and I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh and hep”
Reviews.Author: shyshine_183
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Gansevoort during my business trip to NY. my stay at this place was worth every penny. The hotel is situated in the city center and getting to a subway or hiring a cab is easy. The rooms are quite big and clean. The room that i was staying in had one wall made of glass, so the view from the room was fantastic. The bathrooms are neat and clean and did not smell foul. The room had a queen sized bed which was very comfortable, in general service provided was top. The hotel also has a very popular night club. there are many coffee shops close by to the hotel, good time to spend the evening with friends. The breakfast which is complimentary with stay is also good. The hotel is slightly expensive, but the stay is worth every penny spent. The stay indeed was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: zoublioux
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Gansevoort for a one night surprise stay. The meat packing district was a great time, followed by express entry to the upstairs patio lounge/club. The room itself was spacious wit h a great view of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Fay86
Reviews.Content: Love the Gansevoort, Love meatpacking. Great shops, restaurants, NY Culture, Nightlife all in one! - Gansevoort is a seriously cool hotel with great rooms and views out towards to hudson. I do have to say that the club upstairs / bar is very shabby now and needs a major refurb. You almost dont want to sit down on the seats during the day! - at night it all looks very cool but under the critcal daylight - pretty gross ! Service has always been great and would return time and time again. p.s Spa is really great.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT TO STAY AT THIS HOTEL - Horrid service”
Reviews.Author: marimelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gansevoort for four nights in June 2007 on a business trip. It was one of the worst hotel stays I've ever experienced. The front desk agents didn't wear nametags - very indicative of the Gansevoort's attitude towards customer service: anonymous, impersonal, and apathetic. Nobody is accountable for anything. The TV wasn't working when we got in the room, so the bellhop promised he would send somebody to fix it. Nobody came. A couple of hours later, we had to call the operator to ask them to send somebody. Later on that afternoon, we decided to go up to the roof to check out the view from the much-hyped rooftop pool. As we exited the elevator, a couple of security bouncers stopped us and told us we were not allowed to go into what looked like a lounge area because it was reserved for a private party. We asked if we could go into the pool area and a woman -- not the security people who just talked to us -- interjected and told us the pool is only for hotel guests. I could not believe the impudence of this woman assuming we weren't hotel guests! (By the way, the Gansevoort rented out this lounge area every night of our four-night stay so don't expect to be able to hang out there.) The rooftop parties were pretty loud. The hotel has 14 floors, and despite being six stories down on the 8th floor, I could hear the music anyway. Very annoying at midnight when you're trying to get some sleep. The hotel is also not environmentally friendly (they changed the sheets after the first day). I had to write a note daily to the housekeeper asking them not to change the sheets. On two of the days, I was there when Housekeeping came in, and even with the note I had written, both days the housekeeper started removing the sheets from the bed and I had to stop her, saying it wasn't necessary. While most hotels provide cards in-room asking you to place the card on your bed as a sign to let Housekeeping know not to change your sheets, it's disappointing and irresponsible that the Gansevoort provides no such water- and energy-saving option to its guests. Because there is a nightclub at the hotel, there is a velvet rope at the hotel's front door in the evenings. After a long day, I found it annoying and inconvenient getting stopped at the door and having to produce my room key before being allowed entrance. On the second day of my stay, I called my company's travel department and complained about the terrible service. They spoke with someone in Sales (first name Kristen - can't remember the last name) and Kristen assured our travel department that she would contact me to find out what they can do to alleviate the problems I had been having. On the third day of my stay, I called my company's travel department again to let them know Kristen never contacted me and they left a message for her, but I never heard from Kristen (or anyone from Sales). I thought it was dishonest and in bad form to promise to do something and then not do it. DO NOT TO STAY AT THIS HOTEL. It's not worth your money and the staff won't care about you. There are plenty of other places to stay at in New York (check the reviews of the top-rated hotels here on Tripadvisor.com -- you'll see the PR/sales managers replying to bad reviews asking past guests to contact them about the problems they had. That's what I call good service and you're much better off giving them your business.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ICMChicago
Reviews.Content: Our organization had a terrible time paying for lodging through our corporate credit card. If you plan to use a corporate credit card, i would go somewhere else. Our employees ended up charging their room to their own credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Great girls' weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: geauxtigers318
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Gansevoort the first weekend in December. You definitely can't beat the location. I have stayed in other neighborhoods in Manhattan and loved this one. There are great restaurants and shops in the Meatpacking district and the west village is adjacent to it (great stuff there too). The hotel was nice. The front desk staff was very accomodating. My only complaint about the staff is that the concierge was aloof and arrogant and basically unhelpful. I requested a reservation at Abe and Arthurs (great, by the way). The concierge told me that I would never get a reservation there because it was new. I'm not sure he called because I did and got one myself! Otherwise the rooms were nice. There were 3 of us so we were a bit cramped in the two double beds (queens would be better) but we didn't spend much time in the room. We faced Hudson St. and street level noise wasn't an issue for us and we were only on the 3rd floor. We did have noisy neighbors who slammed the door all night the first night but then left. I would stay here again for the location for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Trop2
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little apprehensive. I phoned the hotel in advance to confirm the details of our reservation, which had been booked through Orbitz, and am glad I did. The only problem was that we had paid extra for a Deluxe room, but the hotel had us listed as having reserved a Superior room. Once the hotel clerk double-checked the reservation, she immediately corrected it from a Superior room to a Deluxe room, which is actually superior to a "Superior" room. Everything was in order when we arrived. The room was just as nice as depicted on the website. The staff was extremely friendly and solicitous. Every request was punctually met and the room was as quiet as any street-side room can be. I downloaded a "white noise" app onto my iPhone and we used the docking station in the room to use the phone app to help screen street noise. It worked. The beds are indeed extremely comfortable; the bathroom was spacious, with lots of storage and counter space, and the shower had good water pressure and consistent and plentiful hot water. The towels are big and fluffy. Appreciated extras: umbrellas stored in the closet, and complimentary wine and chocolates waiting upon arrival. We had to ask, though, if they were complimentary - we didn't want to be charged an exhorbitant amount for indulging. A note to that effect would have been appreciated. My only complaint is that the hotel doesn't have ice and vending machines. Although they will deliver ice to your room, it involves a little bit of a wait and the usual tip to the delivery person. I'd prefer walking down the hall to get my own ice whenever I want it, morning or evening. Although we liked having a refrigerator in the room, it was crammed full of expensive stuff that we didn't want to indulge in. We moved some of it out of the fridge and stored sodas from the deli on 14th Street for our own use. Some free room in the refrigerator would have been appreciated - or more reasonably priced goods stocked inside of it would have been more convenient. The hotel is nicely located, near the High Line trail, within walking distance of Greenwich Village, two subway lines and surrounded by great restaurants and is close to a few small convenience stores. The Pastis restaurant across the street has great food, but a reservation is recommended or you'll have to wait a while for a tiny little table and eat elbow-to-elbow with strangers. We didn't care about the night club on the hotel roof, but the traffic to and fro didn't impact our visit in any way. All in all, this is a very nice hotel and we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “hip ultra cool hotel in the heart of the best neighborhood in NYC”
Reviews.Author: cdmanley19
Reviews.Content: We highly recomend the Hotel Gansevoort. the staff and the service are 1st class. We spent a few nights in the hotel and had a great time with our family. Our 2 kids Olivia and Dylan loved the room and the hip Neighborhood. Walking distance to everything, the highline, soho and west village are all near by... The Concierage had great recomendations for places to eat and visit during our quick visit. I highly recomend the Hotel Gansevoort and for sure we will return in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Hot spot in NY”
Reviews.Author: bebedora
Reviews.Content: The area of MPD is very cool and you have many things to do and many shops to visit. This hotel is very convenient to enjoy this area during your stay. In the morning, you may enjoy jogging along the Hudson river, and at night the bar show you a gorgeous night view as well. Except the noisy nights for THU-SUN, I believe you can enjoy another NY life other than the 5th avenue, the Empire state bldg, or MET.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Aazizjuly04
Reviews.Content: Ok so we all went on a night out on the town in NYC and decided to stay at the Hotel Gansevoort, I got the Gansevoort suite and it was simply everything I asked for and more, it was worth every penny. I have paid a few thousand a night to pay at other hotels, but the price and location of this suite was simply unbeatable. I mean you can do all your searching online for all the best hotels, and I assure you this is number one. For started when you go in they have your name inside a letter welcomeing you to the hotel, they had chocalate covered strawberrys setup for me inside the room, yes the suite was that classy. The rooftop had a fantastic veiw of manhattan, simply the best. You feel as if your in another world of class and comfort, did I forget to mention the sweet had two balconies!!! I travel alot and review alot and this hotel is legit! I used www.wisetravelbuddy.com to find hotel Gansevoort! this hotel is worth it, trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitty2728
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, big rooms, best bed's I ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: AliMartins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gansevoort for only one night as I was in town for a meeting so I really didnt get a chance to experience it all, specially the pool which I had heard such great reviews about. Nevertheless, the staff was excellent, helped me get around town easily and the meatpacking district, where it is located has changed a lot and it is a great place to go out at night, fine restaurants and bars. Definitely would come back with a friend for a fun weekend in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not for so great for kids”
Reviews.Author: cassiope
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly for the roof swimming pool which was nice although small and often very packed. The staff is quite friendly and they do try hard for children (e.g. the welcome pack full of sweets and crisps which is a nice gesture) but I would not recommend this hotel for families with children as (i) the food is too sophisticated for them, (ii) it is 20 mn in taxi from Manhattan and (iii) the area is quite rough. Yes the pool is nice but we had a better time in the Parker Meridien (which also has a huge indoor roof pool) and is very close to the shops, museums and the park. Note: no music or light inside the pool and no video games for children as advertised on their website. If you want to party and like the area this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location combined with a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SnowboardGrrl
Reviews.Content: I thought the Hotel Gansevoort was an ideal combination of location and hotel. As a first time visitor to NYC, I really enjoyed the trendy neighborhood (ie., great restaurants, shopping, and clubs). The Chelsea food market, Magnolia's bakery, STK - to name a few. It makes me salivate just thinking of these culinary delights! The hotel is modern and tastefully appointed. The room was very comfortable and offered a spacious bathroom. I certainly appreciated many of the little details that had been included in the room. Some hotels promise - Hotel Gansevoort delivers. The staff were extremely helpful in assisting us with our local destinations - suggesting great night spots, transportation routes, and other miscellaneous details. It made our vacation the best trip of our lives!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - You won't get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: maverick3934
Reviews.Content: Took my fiance here on a saturday night because she had just arrived from the airport and wanted to celebrate. I hadn't seen her in a month. The room they gave me , the bed was broken. They sent someone up to fix it because apparently the slats fell out (it's a memory foam mattress). Even after they fixed it the bed was wobbly and would sink in the middle. The windows were stuck and wouldn't even close properly, besides the windows being paper thin. There was also a dead roach by the table in the center of the room. I heard the sounds of cabs beeping all night as well as buses and trucks moving by. I checked out around 4 am after being unable to sleep. I talked to the staff and they wouldn't change my room nor would send anyone to fix the bed or window. They said the windows are just thin, fixing it to close won't do anything. They also said the bed was fixed, which it really wasn't. I routinely travel and have never had an experience like this except at a motel in long island many years ago. A hotel doesn't treat people like this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bar in New York”
Reviews.Author: mauricemaher
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern, the rooms are pretty much right out of "dwell" magazine very cool. Staff are great and the rooms are very clean. In New York we did not know what to tip housekeeping so we just put most of our change under the pillow each day (around 4-5 bucks) When we got back every day our room was spotless. I have to say that I have trouble sleeping if the room is dirty, not here. The cleanest hotel I have been to-period. The location is great, you are within 3 blocks of the east west and north south subway lines (8th and 14th st) Also 1 block away from the Chelsea food market (a must see visit but only takes about 30 min to go through) as for walking if you walk fast you can count for about 45 seconds per block, but the general rule is about 1 minute. so from here to the start of central park (8th and 60th) will take you about 45 min to walk. You are within a 1 hour walk of all the museums but the subway is very safe and will take you about 5-10 min to get to where you want to go. We walked for the first 2 days and then started running out of time, so started taking the subway every where. Don't go by some 80's b horror movie, the New York system is fine very safe, very fast and very easy to understand. Well as for the title the roof top bar seems to be the new "it" place in NYC, but as a guest you get in for free and get to dodge the couple hundred investment bakers, lawyers and stock brokers in line. The views from the roof are awesome, tunes are great and the drinks aren't that bad (about 9 bucks for a pint of stella and 12 bucks for a glass of red). The bar is a must see I went there three out of the five nights I was there, even if it was just for a night cap. Maurice from Kamloops

Reviews.Title: “Just the getaway this mom needed!”
Reviews.Author: montrezor
Reviews.Content: I desperately needed time away from my child, where I could shop â€˜til I drop and pamper myself to the fullest. A friend highly recommended the Gansevoort Hotel in New York so I went on line and booked the moment I dropped my little one off to mom and dadâ€¦ Upon my arrival I was greeted by very upbeat staff that made it clear that I was in good hands. The rooms arenâ€™t the biggest but have all the comforts you need and it is NYC after allâ€¦ Apart from all the great shopping in the area, the hotel has everything you could ever need to escape. A fabulous sushi restaurant and a breathtaking roof top pool bar that hosts some best times Iâ€™ve had in yearsâ€¦ Location is everything in NYC and the hotel is steps away from the famous STK where I had melt in your mouth mini burgers.
